docs.title: ⏰ Phân bổ thời gian (1.5 - 2 giờ)
docs.text:
1. Từ vựng (30 phút): Học cụm từ về prices và costs.
  2. Number Practice (20 phút): Luyện tập nghe số tiền và giá cả.
  3. TOEIC Part 2 Focus (25 phút): Chiến lược câu hỏi về prices.
  4. Pattern Practice (25 phút): Luyện tập mẫu hội thoại về giá cả.
  5. Review & Homework (10 phút): Tổng kết và bài tập về nhà.

docs.title: a. Hỏi về giá cả (Asking About Prices)
docs.text: Câu hỏi Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ How much is...? /haʊ mʌtʃ ɪz/ WH-Q ...giá bao nhiêu? How much is this laptop? What's the price of...? /wʌts ðə praɪs ʌv/ WH-Q Giá của...là bao nhiêu? What's the price of the premium package? How much does it cost? /haʊ mʌtʃ dʌz ɪt kɔːst/ WH-Q Nó có giá bao nhiêu? How much does it cost to ship overseas? What does it run? /wʌt dʌz ɪt rʌn/ WH-Q Nó có giá bao nhiêu? (informal) What does a good laptop run these days? Can you tell me the cost? /kæn juː tel miː ðə kɔːst/ Polite Q Bạn có thể cho biết giá? Can you tell me the cost of installation? What's the total? /wʌts ðə ˈtoʊt̬əl/ WH-Q Tổng cộng bao nhiêu? What's the total including tax? How much do I owe? /haʊ mʌtʃ duː aɪ oʊ/ WH-Q Tôi phải trả bao nhiêu? How much do I owe for the repairs? What's the damage? /wʌts ðə ˈdæmɪdʒ/ WH-Q Hỏng bao nhiêu tiền? (informal) What's the damage for dinner tonight? Is there a fee for...? /ɪz ðer ə fiː fɔːr/ Y/N Q Có phí cho...không? Is there a fee for early check-out? Are there any additional charges? /ɑːr ðer ˈeni əˈdɪʃənəl ˈtʃɑːrdʒəz/ Y/N Q Có phí phụ trội nào không? Are there any additional charges I should know about?

docs.title: b. Trả lời về giá cả (Price Responses)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ It costs... /ɪt kɔːsts/ Statement Nó có giá... It costs fifty dollars per hour. The price is... /ðə praɪs ɪz/ Statement Giá là... The price is $299, including tax. That'll be... /ðæt əl biː/ Statement Tổng cộng sẽ là... That'll be $15.50, please. It runs about... /ɪt rʌnz əˈbaʊt/ Statement Nó có giá khoảng... It runs about $200 for a good one. You're looking at... /jʊr ˈlʊkɪŋ æt/ Statement Bạn sẽ phải trả khoảng... You're looking at around $500 for installation. It's priced at... /ɪts praɪst æt/ Statement Nó được định giá... It's priced at $89.99. The total comes to... /ðə ˈtoʊt̬əl kʌmz tuː/ Statement Tổng cộng là... The total comes to $157.80. There's a charge of... /ðerz ə tʃɑːrdʒ ʌv/ Statement Có một khoản phí... There's a charge of $25 for delivery. No charge for that /noʊ tʃɑːrdʒ fɔːr ðæt/ Statement Không tính phí No charge for that service. It's included in the price /ɪts ɪnˈkluːdəd ɪn ðə praɪs/ Statement Đã bao gồm trong giá Installation is included in the price.

docs.title: c. Từ vựng về tiền và đơn vị (Money & Units)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ dollar /ˈdɑːlər/ (n) đô la The item costs twenty dollars. cent /sent/ (n) xu That's fifty cents extra. price /praɪs/ (n) giá The price includes shipping. cost /kɔːst/ (n/v) giá/tốn The cost of living is high here. fee /fiː/ (n) phí There's a processing fee of $5. charge /tʃɑːrdʒ/ (n/v) phí/tính phí We don't charge for consultations. rate /reɪt/ (n) tỷ lệ/giá The hourly rate is $75. fare /fer/ (n) cước phí The bus fare is $2.50. toll /toʊl/ (n) phí cầu đường The bridge toll is $4. tuition /tuːˈɪʃən/ (n) học phí Tuition for the course is $800. deposit /dɪˈpɑːzət/ (n) tiền đặt cọc We require a $100 deposit. balance /ˈbæləns/ (n) số dư Your account balance is $250. total /ˈtoʊt̬əl/ (n) tổng cộng The total is $45.75. subtotal /ˈsʌbtoʊt̬əl/ (n) tạm tính The subtotal before tax is $40. tax /tæks/ (n) thuế Sales tax is 8.5%. tip /tɪp/ (n) tiền boa A 15% tip is customary. discount /ˈdɪskaʊnt/ (n) giảm giá Students get a 10% discount. surcharge /ˈsɜːrtʃɑːrdʒ/ (n) phí phụ trội There's a fuel surcharge of $15.

docs.title: d. So sánh giá cả (Price Comparisons)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ more expensive /mɔːr ɪkˈspensɪv/ Comparative đắt hơn This model is more expensive. less expensive /les ɪkˈspensɪv/ Comparative rẻ hơn The basic plan is less expensive. cheaper /ˈtʃiːpər/ Comparative rẻ hơn Online prices are usually cheaper. pricier /ˈpraɪsiər/ Comparative đắt hơn Premium services are pricier. the most expensive /ðə moʊst ɪkˈspensɪv/ Superlative đắt nhất This is the most expensive option. the cheapest /ðə ˈtʃiːpəst/ Superlative rẻ nhất That's the cheapest rate available. costs twice as much /kɔːsts twaɪs æz mʌtʃ/ Comparison đắt gấp đôi The deluxe version costs twice as much. half the price /hæf ðə praɪs/ Comparison nửa giá Generic brands are half the price. costs the same /kɔːsts ðə seɪm/ Comparison giá như nhau Both options cost the same. competitively priced /kəmˈpetətɪvli praɪst/ Description giá cạnh tranh Our products are competitively priced. reasonably priced /ˈriːzənəbli praɪst/ Description giá hợp lý The restaurant is reasonably priced. overpriced /ˌoʊvərˈpraɪst/ Description đắt quá mức I think that item is overpriced. a good value /ə ɡʊd ˈvæljuː/ Description đáng giá It's expensive but a good value. worth the money /wɜːrθ ðə ˈmʌni/ Description đáng đồng tiền The quality makes it worth the money.

docs.title: e. Phương thức thanh toán (Payment Methods)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ cash /kæʃ/ (n) tiền mặt Do you accept cash payments? credit card /ˈkredət kɑːrd/ (n) thẻ tín dụng Can I pay with a credit card? debit card /ˈdebət kɑːrd/ (n) thẻ ghi nợ I'll use my debit card. check /tʃek/ (n) séc We accept personal checks. money order /ˈmʌni ˈɔːrdər/ (n) phiếu chuyển tiền You can pay by money order. wire transfer /ˈwaɪər ˈtrænsfər/ (n) chuyển khoản International payments require wire transfer. online payment /ˈɔːnlaɪn ˈpeɪmənt/ (n) thanh toán online Online payment is more convenient. mobile payment /ˈmoʊbaɪl ˈpeɪmənt/ (n) thanh toán di động We accept mobile payments. installments /ɪnˈstɔːlmənts/ (n) trả góp You can pay in monthly installments. upfront payment /ˈʌpfrʌnt ˈpeɪmənt/ (n) thanh toán trước We require 50% upfront payment. payment plan /ˈpeɪmənt plæn/ (n) kế hoạch thanh toán We offer flexible payment plans. automatic payment /ˌɔːtəˈmætɪk ˈpeɪmənt/ (n) thanh toán tự động Set up automatic payments for bills.

docs.title: f. Phí và chi phí đặc biệt (Special Fees & Costs)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ handling fee /ˈhændlɪŋ fiː/ (n) phí xử lý There's a $5 handling fee. processing fee /ˈprɑːsesɪŋ fiː/ (n) phí xử lý Credit cards have a processing fee. service charge /ˈsɜːrvəs tʃɑːrdʒ/ (n) phí dịch vụ The service charge is 15%. delivery fee /dɪˈlɪvəri fiː/ (n) phí giao hàng Delivery fee depends on distance. shipping cost /ˈʃɪpɪŋ kɔːst/ (n) phí vận chuyển Shipping costs are extra. late fee /leɪt fiː/ (n) phí trả muộn There's a $25 late fee. cancellation fee /ˌkænsəˈleɪʃən fiː/ (n) phí hủy Cancellation fees apply after 24 hours. setup fee /ˈsetʌp fiː/ (n) phí thiết lập The setup fee is waived this month. maintenance cost /ˈmeɪntənəns kɔːst/ (n) chi phí bảo trì Annual maintenance costs are $200. insurance premium /ɪnˈʃʊrəns ˈpriːmiəm/ (n) phí bảo hiểm Insurance premiums have increased. membership fee /ˈmembərʃɪp fiː/ (n) phí thành viên Annual membership fee is $50. registration fee /ˌredʒɪˈstreɪʃən fiː/ (n) lệ phí đăng ký Registration fee includes materials.

docs.title: Các dạng câu hỏi về giá cả thường gặp:
docs.text:
1. "How much" Questions: 

Q: How much does shipping cost?
✅ A: It's $15 for standard delivery.
❌ B: We ship worldwide.
❌ C: Shipping takes 3-5 business days.

2. Price Information Questions: 

Q: What's the price of the monthly subscription?
✅ A: It's $29.99 per month.
❌ B: The subscription includes many features.
❌ C: Monthly subscriptions are popular.

3. Payment Method Questions: 

Q: Do you accept credit cards?
✅ A: Yes, we take Visa and MasterCard.
❌ B: Credit cards are very convenient.
❌ C: How would you like to pay?

4. Cost Comparison Questions: 

Q: Is the premium plan more expensive?
✅ A: Yes, it costs $20 more per month.
❌ B: The premium plan has extra features.
❌ C: Most customers choose the basic plan.

docs.title: Wrong Answer Patterns:
docs.text:
• Features Instead of Price: Description of what you get instead of cost
  • Time/Process Instead of Cost: How long it takes instead of how much
  • Questions as Responses: Asking back instead of answering

docs.title: 💡 3. Mẫu hội thoại về giá cả (Common Price Patterns)
Pattern 1: Simple Price Inquiry
docs.text:
Customer: How much is this jacket?
Salesperson: It's $89.99.
Customer: Is that the sale price?
Salesperson: Yes, it's 20% off the regular price.
Customer: That's a good deal. I'll take it.

docs.title: Pattern 2: Service Cost Discussion
docs.text:
Customer: What does it cost to have my car serviced?
Mechanic: That depends on what needs to be done. A basic service is $150.
Customer: What about if I need new brakes?
Mechanic: Brake replacement would be around $400.
Customer: Can I get an estimate first?

docs.title: Pattern 3: Payment Options
docs.text:
Customer: How much is the total?
Cashier: Your total comes to $247.50.
Customer: Can I pay half now and half later?
Cashier: We offer payment plans for purchases over $200.
Customer: Perfect. What are the terms?

docs.title: Pattern 4: Fee Clarification
docs.text:
Customer: Are there any additional fees?
Agent: There's a $25 processing fee for applications.
Customer: Is that refundable if I'm not approved?
Agent: No, the processing fee is non-refundable.
Customer: I understand. Please proceed.

docs.title: Exercise A: Price Question Responses
docs.text:
Choose the best response for each price question:

  1. "How much does overnight shipping cost?" A. It arrives by 10 AM the next day. B. It costs an additional $25. C. Overnight shipping is very reliable.

  2. "What's the price difference between these two models?" A. The newer model is $150 more. B. Both models have excellent reviews. C. The features vary between models.

  3. "Is there a discount for bulk orders?" A. Bulk orders are processed faster. B. Yes, 10% off orders over 100 units. C. We have many bulk customers.

  4. "Do you charge for installation?" A. Installation takes about two hours. B. Our technicians are very experienced. C. No, installation is included in the price.

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-A, 3-B, 4-C

docs.title: Exercise B: Complete the Price Conversation
docs.text:
Fill in the blanks with appropriate price-related expressions:

Customer: _ much does this computer cost? Salesperson: The _ is $899 for this model. Customer: That seems a bit _. Do you have anything cheaper? Salesperson: We have this model for $649. It _ about $250 less. Customer: What's _ in that price? Salesperson: The price _ warranty and setup. Customer: Are there any additional _? Salesperson: No _ fees. That's the total price.

Answer Key: How, price, expensive/pricey, costs, included, includes, charges/fees, additional/extra

docs.title: Exercise C: Match Price Contexts
docs.text:
Match each price question with the most likely response:

Questions: 1. "How much is parking here?" 2. "What's the cover charge tonight?" 3. "Is there a fee to change my flight?" 4. "How much do you charge for alterations?" 5. "What's the cost per page for printing?"

Responses: A. "It's $20 at the door." B. "Yes, there's a $75 change fee." C. "It depends on what needs to be altered." D. "It's $2 per hour or $15 for all day." E. "Black and white copies are 10 cents each."

Answer Key: 1-D, 2-A, 3-B, 4-C, 5-E

docs.title: DO:
docs.text: ✅ Listen for specific numbers - prices, amounts, percentages ✅ Pay attention to currency mentions - dollars, cents, fees ✅ Notice comparison words - more, less, cheaper, expensive ✅ Focus on payment-related vocabulary - cost, charge, fee, price

docs.title: DON'T:
docs.text: ❌ Choose feature descriptions when asked about price ❌ Select process information when cost is requested ❌ Pick responses about time when money is the question ❌ Ignore qualification words like "additional," "extra," "included"

docs.title: Business Pricing:
docs.text:
• "Our rates are competitive in the market"
• "Volume discounts are available for large orders"
• "Pricing varies based on specifications"
• "We offer tiered pricing for different service levels"

docs.title: Negotiation Language:
docs.text:
• "Is there any room for negotiation?"
• "What's your best price?"
• "Can you match that competitor's price?"
• "We need to work within our budget constraints"

docs.title: Cost Analysis:
docs.text:
• "Let's break down the costs"
• "The total cost of ownership includes maintenance"
• "Hidden costs can add up quickly"
• "Return on investment should be considered"

docs.title: Shopping/Retail:
docs.text:
Q: How much is this item on sale?
A: It's marked down to $39.99 from $59.99.

docs.title: Services:
docs.text:
Q: What do you charge for consulting?
A: Our hourly rate is $150.

docs.title: Transportation:
docs.text:
Q: How much is a taxi to the airport?
A: It usually runs about $45, plus tip.

docs.title: Utilities/Bills:
docs.text:
Q: What's the monthly cost for internet service?
A: Basic service is $49.99 per month.

docs.title: Number Confusion:
docs.text:
❌ "Thirteen" ($13) vs "Thirty" ($30)
❌ "Fifteen" ($15) vs "Fifty" ($50)
❌ "Four hundred" ($400) vs "Fourteen" ($14)
❌ Missing "cents" or "dollars" context

docs.title: Response Errors:
docs.text:
❌ Q: "How much does it cost?" A: "It's very popular" (popularity not price)
❌ Q: "What's the price?" A: "It comes in three colors" (features not cost)
❌ Q: "Is there a charge?" A: "Many customers ask that" (avoiding not answering)

docs.title: Digital Payments:
docs.text:
• "We accept Apple Pay and Google Pay"
• "You can pay through our mobile app"
• "Contactless payment is available"
• "We use secure payment processing"

docs.title: Subscription Models:
docs.text:
• "It's a monthly recurring charge"
• "You can cancel your subscription anytime"
• "The first month is free, then $9.99 monthly"
• "Annual plans offer significant savings"

docs.title: E-commerce:
docs.text:
• "Total includes shipping and handling"
• "Tax will be calculated at checkout"
• "Promo codes can be entered during payment"
• "We offer buy now, pay later options"

docs.title: Daily Practice (15-20 phút)
docs.text:
1. Price Vocabulary: Ôn 30 từ vựng về prices & costs
  2. Number Listening: Practice nghe số tiền bằng tiếng Anh (10 phút)
  3. Speaking: Ask about prices của 5 sản phẩm/dịch vụ

docs.title: Self-Study Activities
docs.text:
1. Shopping Practice: Go to stores và practice asking prices in English
  2. Receipt Analysis: Review receipts và describe costs in English
  3. Price Comparison: Compare prices của similar products và discuss

docs.title: Day 61: Asking About People (Hỏi về Người)
Day 61: Asking About People (Hỏi về Người)
docs.text: Chào mừng bạn đến với Ngày 61! Hôm nay chúng ta tiếp tục PHASE 5: LISTENING SPECIFIC với chủ đề Asking About People (Hỏi về Người). Bài học này tập trung vào các câu hỏi về thông tin cá nhân, chức danh công việc, và mối quan hệ thường xuất hiện trong Part 2 của TOEIC. Đây là dạng câu hỏi rất phổ biến trong giao tiếp hằng ngày và môi trường làm việc.

docs.title: 🎯 Mục tiêu bài học
docs.text:
• Nắm vững 60+ cụm từ về asking about people trong TOEIC Part 2.
  • Luyện nghe (Listening): Phân biệt câu hỏi về người và đáp án phù hợp (Part 2).
  • Luyện đọc (Reading): Hiểu thông tin về nhân vật trong văn bản (Part 6-7).
  • Giao tiếp: Thực hành hỏi thông tin về người khác một cách lịch sự.

docs.title: ⏰ Phân bổ thời gian (1.5 - 2 giờ)
docs.text:
1. Từ vựng (30 phút): Học cụm từ về asking about people.
  2. Question Patterns (25 phút): Nắm vững các mẫu câu hỏi về người.
  3. TOEIC Part 2 Focus (25 phút): Chiến lược câu hỏi về people.
  4. Response Practice (25 phút): Luyện tập trả lời về thông tin cá nhân.
  5. Review & Homework (10 phút): Tổng kết và bài tập về nhà.

docs.title: a. Hỏi về danh tính (Asking About Identity)
docs.text: Câu hỏi Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ Who is...? /huː ɪz/ WH-Q ...là ai? Who is the new manager? Who was that? /huː wʌz ðæt/ WH-Q Người đó là ai? Who was that on the phone? What's his name? /wʌts hɪz neɪm/ WH-Q Tên anh ấy là gì? What's his name again? What's her name? /wʌts hər neɪm/ WH-Q Tên cô ấy là gì? What's her name - the accountant? Who's calling? /huːz ˈkɔːlɪŋ/ WH-Q Ai gọi đây? May I ask who's calling? Who's in charge? /huːz ɪn tʃɑːrdʒ/ WH-Q Ai phụ tr책? Who's in charge of this project? Who does she work for? /huː dʌz ʃi wɜːrk fɔːr/ WH-Q Cô ấy làm việc cho ai? Who does she work for now? Whose office is this? /huːz ˈɔːfəs ɪz ðɪs/ WH-Q Văn phòng này của ai? Whose office is this on the third floor? Who's the person...? /huːz ðə ˈpɜːrsən/ WH-Q Ai là người...? Who's the person handling reservations? Can you tell me who...? /kæn juː tel miː huː/ Polite Q Bạn có thể cho biết ai...? Can you tell me who your supervisor is?

docs.title: b. Hỏi về công việc (Asking About Jobs)
docs.text: Câu hỏi Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ What does he do? /wʌt dʌz hiː duː/ WH-Q Anh ấy làm nghề gì? What does he do for a living? What's her job? /wʌts hər dʒɑːb/ WH-Q Công việc cô ấy là gì? What's her job at the company? Where does he work? /wer dʌz hiː wɜːrk/ WH-Q Anh ấy làm việc ở đâu? Where does he work now? What's his position? /wʌts hɪz pəˈzɪʃən/ WH-Q Chức vụ anh ấy là gì? What's his position in the department? What department is she in? /wʌt dɪˈpɑːrtmənt ɪz ʃi ɪn/ WH-Q Cô ấy ở phòng ban nào? What department is she in? Who's her boss? /huːz hər bɔːs/ WH-Q Sếp cô ấy là ai? Who's her boss in the marketing team? What company does he work for? /wʌt ˈkʌmpəni dʌz hiː wɜːrk fɔːr/ WH-Q Anh ấy làm việc cho công ty nào? What company does he work for? Is she the manager? /ɪz ʃi ðə ˈmænədʒər/ Y/N Q Cô ấy có phải quản lý không? Is she the manager of this branch? Does he work here? /dʌz hiː wɜːrk hɪr/ Y/N Q Anh ấy có làm việc ở đây không? Does he work here full-time? How long has she worked there? /haʊ lɔːŋ hæz ʃi wɜːrkt ðer/ WH-Q Cô ấy đã làm việc ở đó bao lâu? How long has she worked there?

docs.title: c. Hỏi về mối quan hệ (Asking About Relationships)
docs.text: Câu hỏi Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ How do you know him? /haʊ duː juː noʊ hɪm/ WH-Q Bạn biết anh ấy như thế nào? How do you know him? Are they related? /ɑːr ðeɪ rɪˈleɪtəd/ Y/N Q Họ có họ hàng không? Are they related or just colleagues? Is she your colleague? /ɪz ʃi jʊr ˈkɑːliːɡ/ Y/N Q Cô ấy có phải đồng nghiệp bạn không? docs.title: Các dạng câu hỏi về người thường gặp:
docs.text:
1. "Who" Questions: 

Q: Who's the person in charge of marketing?
✅ A: That would be Sarah Johnson.
❌ B: Marketing is on the third floor.
❌ C: We have a great marketing campaign.

2. Job/Position Questions: 

Q: What does Michael do at the company?
✅ A: He's the IT manager.
❌ B: He's been here for three years.
❌ C: Michael is very reliable.

3. Workplace Questions: 

Q: Where does she work now?
✅ A: She works at the downtown office.
❌ B: She works very hard.
❌ C: She likes her job.

4. Relationship Questions: 

Q: How do you know Jennifer?
✅ A: We went to college together.
❌ B: Jennifer is very nice.
❌ C: I know her well.

docs.title: Wrong Answer Patterns:
docs.text:
• Location Instead of Person: Where someone is instead of who they are
  • Time/Duration: How long instead of who/what job
  • Qualities Instead of Identity: Personality instead of position/name

docs.title: 💡 3. Mẫu hội thoại về người (Common People Patterns)
Pattern 1: Asking About New Employee
docs.text:
A: Who's the new person in accounting?
B: That's Maria Santos. She just started last week.
A: What's her background?
B: She has five years of experience in corporate accounting.
A: Has she settled in well?

docs.title: Pattern 2: Workplace Introductions
docs.text:
A: Do you know who's handling the Peterson account?
B: I believe that's David Kim from sales.
A: Could you introduce me to him?
B: Of course. He's right over there by the copy machine.
A: Great. I need to discuss some details with him.

docs.text:
A: May I ask who's calling?
B: This is Jennifer Wu from Apex Marketing.
A: And who would you like to speak with?
B: I need to talk to someone about your advertising services.
A: Let me connect you with our marketing director.

docs.text:
A: Is that Susan from the legal department?
B: No, that's Rebecca from human resources.
A: Oh, I thought she looked familiar.
B: Susan is the tall woman with short blonde hair.
A: Ah yes, now I remember.

docs.title: Exercise A: People Question Responses
docs.text:
Choose the best response for each question about people:

  1. "Who's your new supervisor?" A. She's been here for two months. B. Her name is Patricia Mills. C. Supervision is very important.

  2. "What does Robert do in the company?" A. He works in the finance department. B. Robert is a very dedicated employee. C. He commutes from the suburbs.

  3. "Where can I find the IT manager?" A. Information technology is crucial. B. The IT department is growing. C. He's usually in his office on the second floor.

  4. "How do you know Lisa?" A. Lisa is very knowledgeable. B. We worked together at my previous job. C. I know her quite well.

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-A, 3-C, 4-B

docs.title: 📚 1. Các dạng Distractors phổ biến (Common Distractor Types)
a. Similar Sound Distractors (Âm thanh tương tự)
docs.text: Question Type Distractor Pattern Correct Answer Wrong Answer Lý do sai Location Sound-alike words "Where is the meeting?" → "In the conference room" "There are three people" THREE ≈ THERE (âm thanh) Time Similar numbers "When does it start?" → "At three o'clock" "It lasts three hours" THREE ≠ start time People Name confusion "Who is calling?" → "This is Janet" "I'm on my way to Japan" JANET ≈ JAPAN (âm thanh) Actions Verb sounds "What are you doing?" → "I'm reading a report" "I need to repair my laptop" READ ≈ REPAIR (âm thanh)

docs.title: b. Topic Shift Distractors (Chuyển đổi chủ đề)
docs.text: Question Focus Distractor Strategy Example Question Wrong Answer Lý do sai Price/Cost Features instead "How much does it cost?" "It has many advanced features" Features ≠ Price Time Duration instead "When does it start?" "It takes two hours" Duration ≠ Start time Location Method instead "Where should I park?" "You can take the bus" Transportation ≠ Parking Person Description instead "Who is the manager?" "The manager is very experienced" Description ≠ Identity

docs.title: c. Word Association Distractors (Liên kết từ vựng)
docs.text: Question Word Related Distractors Correct Context Wrong Context Tại sao gây nhầm Airport Airplane, flight, travel "Where's the airport shuttle?" "The flight was delayed" Cùng chủ đề nhưng khác context Restaurant Food, menu, dinner "Where should we eat?" "The food smells delicious" Cùng ngữ cảnh nhưng không trả lời Office Work, meeting, computer "Where's the copy machine?" "I need to finish this report" Cùng môi trường nhưng khác câu hỏi Bank Money, account, credit "Where can I deposit this?" "My account balance is low" Cùng chủ đề tài chính nhưng khác vấn đề

docs.title: d. Logical but Incorrect Distractors (Hợp lý nhưng sai)
docs.text: Scenario Question Logical Distractor Correct Answer Phân tích Meeting "When does the meeting start?" "The meeting room is ready" "It starts at 2 PM" Room status ≠ Start time Shopping "How much is this shirt?" "That shirt looks great on you" "It's $45" Compliment ≠ Price Travel "Where's the train station?" "The train is very convenient" "It's two blocks from here" Transportation method ≠ Location Work "Who's your supervisor?" "My supervisor is very helpful" "Her name is Sarah Johnson" Quality ≠ Identity

docs.title: Pattern 1: Question Word Mismatch
docs.text:
❌ WHO question → WHAT answer
Q: Who called this morning?
Wrong: What they said was important.
✅ Right: Susan from accounting called.

❌ WHEN question → WHERE answer  
Q: When should I submit this?
Wrong: You can submit it online.
✅ Right: The deadline is Friday.

❌ WHERE question → WHY answer
Q: Where did you park?
Wrong: Because the lot was full.
✅ Right: I parked on the street.

❌ HOW MUCH question → HOW answer
Q: How much does shipping cost?
Wrong: We ship via express delivery.
✅ Right: Shipping costs $15.

docs.title: Pattern 2: Partial Information Trap
docs.text:
❌ Incomplete but related information
Q: What time does the store close?
Wrong: The store is very busy today.
✅ Right: It closes at 9 PM.

❌ Related but not requested detail
Q: Where should I meet you?
Wrong: The meeting is very important.
✅ Right: Let's meet at the lobby.

❌ Context without specific answer
Q: How long will the project take?
Wrong: The project requires careful planning.
✅ Right: It should take about six weeks.

docs.title: Pattern 3: Assumption Traps
docs.text:
❌ Assuming additional information
Q: Do you need a receipt?
Wrong: Yes, for warranty purposes. (assumes why)
✅ Right: No, thank you.

❌ Over-explaining when yes/no asked
Q: Is the report ready?
Wrong: The report covers all departments.
✅ Right: Yes, it's on your desk.

❌ Adding unasked details
Q: Can you help me with this?
Wrong: I helped someone else earlier.
✅ Right: Sure, what do you need?

docs.title: Pattern 4: Time/Tense Confusion
docs.text:
❌ Past for present questions
Q: Are you going to the conference?
Wrong: I went last year.
✅ Right: Yes, I'll be there Tuesday.

❌ Present for future questions
Q: When will the meeting end?
Wrong: The meeting is very productive.
✅ Right: It should end around 4 PM.

❌ Future for past questions
Q: Did you finish the report?
Wrong: I will finish it tomorrow.
✅ Right: Yes, I completed it this morning.

docs.title: Strategy 1: Question Word Focus (Tập trung từ để hỏi)
docs.text:
1. Identify the WH-word (Who, What, When, Where, Why, How)
2. Eliminate answers that don't match the question type
3. Look for specific information requested
4. Avoid answers that are related but don't answer the question

Example:
Q: "Where can I find the supply closet?"
A: It's next to the elevator. ✅
B: Supplies are delivered weekly. ❌ (WHEN, not WHERE)
C: The supplies are running low. ❌ (WHAT condition, not WHERE)

docs.title: Strategy 2: Context Matching (Khớp ngữ cảnh)
docs.text:
1. Understand the situation/setting
2. Match response to the context
3. Eliminate responses from wrong contexts
4. Choose responses that fit the scenario

Example:
Q: "How was your presentation?" (Past tense, asking for evaluation)
A: It went very well, thanks. ✅
B: I'm preparing slides now. ❌ (Future/present action)
C: Presentations are important. ❌ (General statement)

docs.title: Strategy 3: Logical Response Test (Kiểm tra phản hồi logic)
docs.text:
1. Does the answer actually respond to the question?
2. Would a native speaker respond this way?
3. Is it a natural continuation of the conversation?
4. Does it provide the specific information requested?

Example:
Q: "Should I call before I come over?"
A: Yes, that would be helpful. ✅
B: Calling is very convenient. ❌ (Statement, not yes/no)
C: You can call from your car. ❌ (Method, not whether to call)

docs.title: Exercise A: Identify the Distractor Type
docs.text:
For each question and wrong answer, identify which type of distractor it is:

  1. Q: "When does the library close?" Wrong: "The library has many books." Distractor Type: ____

  2. Q: "Who's presenting tomorrow?" Wrong: "Tomorrow is very busy." Distractor Type: ____

  3. Q: "Where should I park?" Wrong: "You can take the subway." Distractor Type: ____

  4. Q: "How much is shipping?" Wrong: "We ship worldwide." Distractor Type: ____

Answer Key: 1-Topic Shift, 2-Similar Sound, 3-Topic Shift, 4-Topic Shift

docs.title: Exercise B: Eliminate Wrong Answers
docs.text:
Choose the correct answer and identify why the others are wrong:

Q: "What time should I pick you up?" A. I'll be ready anytime. B. Pick-up time is flexible. C. How about 7:30 PM?

Wrong answers analysis: A: __ B: __ Correct: C (Gives specific time requested)

Answer Key: A-Doesn't give specific time, B-States flexibility but no time

docs.title: Exercise C: Advanced Pattern Recognition
docs.text:
Identify the wrong answer pattern in each set:

  1. Q: "Are you coming to the party?"
  2. Wrong: "Parties are fun."

  3. Pattern: ____

  4. Q: "Where did you put my keys?"

  5. Wrong: "Keys are important."

  6. Pattern: ____

  7. Q: "How long will you be gone?"

  8. Wrong: "I went there last week."
  9. Pattern: ____

Answer Key: 1-General statement, 2-General statement, 3-Time/tense confusion

docs.title: Pattern 1: The "Yes, but..." Trap
docs.text:
❌ Q: "Can you help me move this?"
Wrong: "Yes, moving is hard work." (Acknowledges but doesn't commit)
✅ Right: "Sure, where do you want it?"

❌ Q: "Do you have time to talk?"
Wrong: "Yes, time is precious." (Philosophical but not answering)
✅ Right: "Of course, what's on your mind?"

docs.title: Pattern 2: The Question-as-Answer Trap
docs.text:
❌ Q: "Where should we meet?"
Wrong: "Where would you prefer?" (Question back)
✅ Right: "Let's meet at the coffee shop."

❌ Q: "What time works for you?"
Wrong: "What time did you have in mind?" (Avoiding answer)
✅ Right: "2 PM would be perfect."

docs.title: Pattern 3: The Related-but-Wrong Context
docs.text:
❌ Q: "Is the printer working?"
Wrong: "The printer is in the copy room." (Location, not status)
✅ Right: "No, it's out of toner."

❌ Q: "How much does parking cost?"
Wrong: "Parking is limited downtown." (Availability, not cost)
✅ Right: "It's $2 per hour."

docs.title: Pattern 4: The Assumption Answer
docs.text:
❌ Q: "Do you want coffee?"
Wrong: "Coffee keeps me awake." (Personal effect, not yes/no)
✅ Right: "Yes, please."

❌ Q: "Should I bring anything?"
Wrong: "Bringing things shows thoughtfulness." (Philosophy, not specific)
✅ Right: "Just bring yourself."

docs.title: The 3-Second Rule:
docs.text:
1. Listen to question (3 seconds)
2. Identify question type (WHO/WHAT/WHEN/WHERE/WHY/HOW)
3. Predict answer type needed
4. Eliminate answers that don't match

Time allocation:
- Question comprehension: 30%
- Prediction: 20% 
- Answer evaluation: 50%

docs.title: The Logic Test:
docs.text:
Ask yourself:
1. Does this answer the specific question asked?
2. Is this a natural response a person would give?
3. Does this fit the context/situation?
4. Is this too general/vague for the specific question?

docs.title: The Content vs. Form Test:
docs.text:
Content (meaning): What information is provided?
Form (structure): Does it match the question type?

Example:
Q: "Who's your doctor?"
A: "Doctors are important." ← Form matches (about doctors) but Content wrong (doesn't identify specific doctor)
B: "Dr. Martinez at City Hospital." ← Both Form and Content correct

docs.title: Listening Strategy:
docs.text:
1. Focus on question word + main content
2. Don't get distracted by similar sounds
3. Listen for specific vs. general information
4. Pay attention to grammatical clues (tense, person)

docs.title: Answer Selection Process:
docs.text:
1. Eliminate obviously wrong answers first
2. Compare remaining options carefully
3. Choose most direct, specific answer
4. Avoid answers that sound "smart" but don't answer question

docs.title: Common Mistakes to Avoid:
docs.text:
❌ Choosing answers with question keywords
❌ Selecting longest/most complex answers
❌ Picking answers that sound formal/professional
❌ Overthinking simple questions

docs.title: Part 6: Text Completion Strategy
docs.text:
📝 APPROACH:
1. Skim entire passage first (30 seconds)
2. Identify text type (email, memo, notice, etc.)
3. Read around each blank (before/after sentences)
4. Choose based on:
   - Grammar fit
   - Logical flow
   - Vocabulary appropriateness
   - Context consistency

⏱️ TIME ALLOCATION:
- 16 questions in 10 minutes
- ~35 seconds per question
- Quick scan → Focus → Decide → Move on

docs.title: Part 7: Reading Comprehension Strategy
docs.text:
📊 APPROACH:
1. Questions first → Know what to look for
2. Scan for keywords and specific information
3. Read strategically (not word-by-word)
4. Use elimination for uncertain answers
5. Manage time strictly

⏰ TIME ALLOCATION:
- Single passages: 1 minute per question
- Multiple passages: 1.5 minutes per question
- Always finish all questions (guess if necessary)

docs.title: Time Management Mastery:
docs.text:
⏰ Part 6 (16 questions, 10 minutes):

- Focus on blanks and surrounding context
- Move quickly, don't overthink
- Mark and return if stuck

⏰ Part 7 (29 questions, 40 minutes):

- Use keywords to locate information
- Eliminate wrong answers systematically
- Guess intelligently if time runs out

docs.title: Reading Technique Hierarchy:
docs.text:

2️⃣ SKIMMING: Get general idea of text
3️⃣ INTENSIVE READING: Understand details fully
4️⃣ INFERENTIAL READING: Read between the lines

🎯 Use appropriate technique for each question type

docs.title: Error Prevention:
docs.text:

- Not reading questions first
- Getting stuck on difficult vocabulary
- Spending too much time on one passage
- Not checking answers against text evidence

✅ Success Habits:
- Always predict answer before looking at options
- Use process of elimination actively  
- Trust your first instinct (usually correct)
- Manage time strictly with practice tests
- Build confidence through consistent practice

docs.title: Exercise A: Reading Speed Baseline Test
docs.text:

Subject: New Office Security Procedures

Dear Team,

Effective Monday, March 15th, we will be implementing enhanced security measures throughout our facilities. All employees must present their ID badges at the main entrance and will need to sign in with the security desk.

Additionally, visitors will be required to provide photo identification and will receive temporary access cards valid for one business day only. Please inform any clients or vendors of these changes in advance.

For questions regarding these new procedures, contact the Security Department at extension 2847.

Best regards,
Sarah Mitchell
Facilities Manager

Questions: 1. When do the new procedures begin? 2. What must employees do at the main entrance? 3. How long are visitor access cards valid?

Time Goal: Complete in under 2 minutes Your Time: __ Accuracy: ___/3

docs.title: a. Announcement Types & Formats (Loại thông báo)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ announcement /əˈnaʊnsmənt/ (n) thông báo The company announcement was posted today. notice /ˈnoʊtəs/ (n) thông báo, giấy báo Please read the notice carefully. notification /ˌnoʊtəfəˈkeɪʃən/ (n) thông báo (chính thức) You will receive email notification. memo /ˈmemoʊ/ (n) bản ghi nhớ The memo was sent to all staff. circular /ˈsɜːrkjələr/ (n) thông báo vòng A circular was distributed to employees. bulletin /ˈbʊlətən/ (n) bản tin Check the bulletin board daily. advisory /ədˈvaɪzəri/ (n) lời khuyên/cảnh báo Weather advisory was issued. alert /əˈlɜːrt/ (n) cảnh báo Security alert was sent immediately. proclamation /ˌprɑːkləˈmeɪʃən/ (n) tuyên bố The mayor's proclamation was read aloud. public notice /ˈpʌblək ˈnoʊtəs/ (n) thông báo công cộng Public notice was posted in the lobby.

docs.title: b. Formal Announcement Language (Ngôn ngữ chính thức)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ We are pleased to announce /wi ɑːr pliːzd tuː əˈnaʊns/ Formal Chúng tôi hân hạnh thông báo We are pleased to announce the new policy. It is hereby announced /ɪt ɪz hɪrˈbaɪ əˈnaʊnst/ Formal Theo đây thông báo It is hereby announced that classes are canceled. Please be informed that /pliːz biː ɪnˈfɔːrmd ðæt/ Formal Xin được thông báo rằng Please be informed that the office will close early. We regret to inform you /wi rɪˈɡret tuː ɪnˈfɔːrm juː/ Formal Chúng tôi tiếc phải thông báo We regret to inform you of the cancellation. Effective immediately /ɪˈfektɪv ɪˈmiːdiətli/ Time Có hiệu lực ngay lập tức Effective immediately, new rules apply. As of [date] /æz ʌv/ Time Kể từ [ngày] As of March 1st, prices will increase. Until further notice /ənˈtɪl ˈfɜːrðər ˈnoʊtəs/ Time Cho đến thông báo mới The facility is closed until further notice. Please note that /pliːz noʊt ðæt/ Attention Xin lưu ý rằng Please note that parking is restricted. Kindly be advised /ˈkaɪndli biː ədˈvaɪzd/ Polite Xin được thông báo Kindly be advised of the schedule change. For your information /fɔːr jʊr ˌɪnfərˈmeɪʃən/ Info Để bạn biết thông tin For your information, the meeting is postponed.

docs.title: c. Time & Date Expressions (Biểu thức thời gian)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ commencing /kəˈmensɪŋ/ (v) bắt đầu Commencing Monday, new hours apply. concluding /kənˈkluːdɪŋ/ (v) kết thúc The event is concluding at 5 PM. during the period /ˈdʊrɪŋ ðə ˈpɪriəd/ Time trong khoảng thời gian During the period of renovation. from [date] to [date] /frʌm tuː/ Duration từ [ngày] đến [ngày] From June 1st to June 15th. between [time] and [time] /bɪˈtwiːn ænd/ Duration từ [giờ] đến [giờ] Between 9 AM and 5 PM. no later than /noʊ ˈleɪtər ðæn/ Deadline không muộn hơn Submit no later than Friday. by [date/time] /baɪ/ Deadline trước [ngày/giờ] Complete by end of business day. prior to /ˈpraɪər tuː/ Before trước khi Prior to the meeting start. subsequent to /ˈsʌbsəkwənt tuː/ After sau khi Subsequent to the announcement. in the interim /ɪn ði ˈɪntərəm/ Meanwhile trong lúc chờ đợi In the interim, use alternative entrance.

docs.title: d. Action & Response Vocabulary (Hành động & phản hồi)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ comply /kəmˈplaɪ/ (v) tuân thủ All staff must comply with new rules. adhere /ædˈhɪr/ (v) tuân theo Please adhere to the guidelines. implement /ˈɪmpləmənt/ (v) thực hiện We will implement changes gradually. enforce /ɪnˈfɔːrs/ (v) thực thi Security will enforce the policy. suspend /səˈspend/ (v) đình chỉ Services are suspended temporarily. resume /rɪˈzuːm/ (v) tiếp tục Operations will resume Monday. discontinue /ˌdɪskənˈtɪnjuː/ (v) ngừng We discontinue this service. modify /ˈmɑːdəfaɪ/ (v) sửa đổi The schedule has been modified. revise /rɪˈvaɪz/ (v) xem xét lại Policies will be revised annually. update /ˈʌpdeɪt/ (v) cập nhật Please update your information. acknowledge /əkˈnɑːlədʒ/ (v) xác nhận Please acknowledge receipt. confirm /kənˈfɜːrm/ (v) xác nhận Confirm your attendance by Friday.

docs.title: e. Business & Office Context (Bối cảnh kinh doanh)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ premises /ˈpremɪsəz/ (n) địa điểm, cơ sở No smoking on company premises. facility /fəˈsɪləti/ (n) cơ sở vật chất The facility will undergo renovation. procedure /prəˈsiːdʒər/ (n) quy trình Follow proper safety procedures. protocol /ˈproʊtəkɔːl/ (n) quy tắc Observe meeting protocols strictly. regulation /ˌreɡjəˈleɪʃən/ (n) quy định New safety regulations apply. guideline /ˈɡaɪdlaɪn/ (n) hướng dẫn Follow these guidelines carefully. policy /ˈpɑːləsi/ (n) chính sách The new dress code policy. mandate /ˈmændeɪt/ (n) lệnh, yêu cầu Mask wearing is now mandated. authorization /ˌɔːθərəˈzeɪʃən/ (n) sự cho phép Authorization is required for access. compliance /kəmˈplaɪəns/ (n) sự tuân thủ Ensure full compliance with rules. violation /ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃən/ (n) vi phạm Any violation will be reported. consequence /ˈkɑːnsəkwəns/ (n) hậu quả Understand the consequences clearly.

docs.title: f. Event & Schedule Vocabulary (Từ vựng sự kiện)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ venue /ˈvenjuː/ (n) địa điểm tổ chức The venue has been changed. postpone /poʊsˈpoʊn/ (v) hoãn lại We must postpone the event. reschedule /riːˈskedʒuːl/ (v) lên lịch lại Please reschedule your appointment. cancel /ˈkænsəl/ (v) hủy bỏ Unfortunately, we must cancel. relocate /ˌriːloʊˈkeɪt/ (v) chuyển địa điểm The meeting will relocate to Room B. registration /ˌredʒɪˈstreɪʃən/ (n) đăng ký Registration is now open. attendance /əˈtendəns/ (n) sự tham dự Your attendance is required. participation /pɑːrˌtɪsəˈpeɪʃən/ (n) sự tham gia Voluntary participation is encouraged. agenda /əˈdʒendə/ (n) chương trình nghị sự Review the agenda beforehand. itinerary /aɪˈtɪnəreri/ (n) hành trình The itinerary includes three stops. capacity /kəˈpæsəti/ (n) sức chứa The room capacity is 50 people. refreshments /rɪˈfreʃmənts/ (n) đồ ăn nhẹ Refreshments will be provided.

docs.title: Standard Announcement Format:
docs.text:
📋 HEADER/SUBJECT
🎯 PURPOSE/MAIN MESSAGE  
📅 TIME/DATE INFORMATION
📍 LOCATION/SCOPE DETAILS
📝 SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS
👤 CONTACT INFORMATION

docs.title: Type 1: Company Policy Change
docs.text:
MEMORANDUM

TO: All Employees
FROM: Human Resources Department  
DATE: March 15, 2024
RE: Updated Dress Code Policy

Effective April 1, 2024, the company dress code will be updated to allow casual attire on Fridays. Please ensure that clothing remains professional and appropriate for client meetings.

For questions, contact HR at extension 2156.

docs.title: Type 2: Event Announcement
docs.text:
ANNOUNCEMENT

Annual Company Picnic

We are pleased to announce that our annual company picnic will be held on Saturday, June 20th, from 11:00 AM to 4:00 PM at Riverside Park.

Registration is required by June 15th. Please contact the Events Committee at events@company.com to confirm your attendance.

Food and beverages will be provided.

docs.title: Type 3: Service Disruption Notice
docs.text:
NOTICE

Temporary Elevator Maintenance

Please be advised that the main elevator will be out of service from Monday, April 8th through Wednesday, April 10th for routine maintenance.

During this period, please use the stairwells or the freight elevator in the rear of the building.

We apologize for any inconvenience.

docs.title: Part 6: Text Completion Strategy
docs.text:
📝 STEP-BY-STEP APPROACH:

1. QUICK SCAN (15 seconds)
   - Identify text type (memo, notice, announcement)
   - Note sender, recipient, subject
   - Understand general purpose

2. ANALYZE EACH BLANK (30 seconds per blank)
   - Read sentence before the blank
   - Read sentence after the blank  
   - Consider grammar and logic
   - Check answer choices

3. CONTEXT VERIFICATION (10 seconds)
   - Does answer fit logically?
   - Is grammar correct?
   - Does it match tone/style?

docs.title: Part 7: Comprehension Questions Strategy
docs.text:
🔍 QUESTION-FIRST APPROACH:

1. READ QUESTIONS FIRST (30 seconds)
   - Identify what information to find
   - Note keywords to scan for
   - Understand question types

2. STRATEGIC SCANNING (45 seconds)
   - Locate relevant sections quickly
   - Focus on dates, names, locations
   - Look for cause-effect relationships

3. ANSWER WITH EVIDENCE (30 seconds per question)
   - Find specific text support
   - Eliminate wrong answers
   - Choose best match

docs.title: Common Question Types:
docs.text: Question Pattern Strategy Example Purpose questions Look for main announcement reason "Why was this notice issued?" Detail questions Scan for specific information "When does the new policy take effect?" Inference questions Read between the lines "What can be inferred about the company?" Vocabulary questions Use context clues "What does 'comply' mean in this context?"

docs.title: Exercise A: Text Completion (Part 6 Style)
docs.text:
Read this announcement and choose the best word for each blank:

COMPANY ANNOUNCEMENT

To: All Staff Members
From: Management
Date: October 15, 2024
Subject: Holiday Schedule Changes

We are writing to inform you of important changes to our holiday schedule. __(1)__ December 23rd through January 2nd, our offices will be closed for the winter holiday period.

__(2)__ employees who need to access the building during this time must obtain special authorization from their department supervisor at least one week in advance.

We __(3)__ that these changes may affect your holiday plans, and we appreciate your understanding and flexibility.

For questions about this policy, please contact Human Resources at hr@company.com.

Best regards,
Management Team

Question 1: A) From B) During C) Between D) Since

Question 2: A) Some B) Any C) Much D) Every

Question 3: A) understand B) require C) announce D) implement

Answer Key: 1-A, 2-B, 3-A

docs.title: Exercise B: Comprehension Questions (Part 7 Style)
docs.text:
Read this public announcement and answer the questions:

CITY TRANSPORTATION NOTICE

Effective Monday, November 1st, Bus Route 45 will be permanently discontinued due to low ridership and budget constraints. The final day of service will be Friday, October 29th.

Passengers who regularly use Route 45 are advised to use alternative transportation options:

• Route 42 provides service to downtown via Oak Street
• Route 48 serves the university district with stops near the hospital
• The new express shuttle runs between the mall and train station every 15 minutes

Free transfer passes will be available at the customer service center for affected passengers through December 31st. Present your current Route 45 monthly pass to receive a transfer pass for any other route.

For route maps and schedules, visit our website at www.citytransit.gov or call the information hotline at (555) 123-RIDE.

City Transportation Authority

Questions: 1. When will Route 45 service end? A) Monday, November 1st B) Friday, October 29th C) December 31st D) It doesn't say

  1. Why is Route 45 being discontinued? A) Construction work B) Vehicle maintenance C) Low ridership and budget issues D) Safety concerns

  2. What do passengers need to get a free transfer pass? A) A government ID B) Their current Route 45 monthly pass C) Proof of residence D) A completed application

  3. How often does the express shuttle run? A) Every 15 minutes B) Every 30 minutes C) Hourly D) Every 45 minutes

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-C, 3-B, 4-A

docs.title: Exercise C: Speed Reading Challenge
docs.text:
Time yourself reading this announcement and answering one question:

LIBRARY ANNOUNCEMENT

The Central Public Library will be implementing new security measures starting Monday, March 6th. All visitors will be required to pass through metal detectors at the main entrance. Bags larger than 8 inches × 10 inches will need to be checked at the security desk and cannot be brought into the reading areas.

Study rooms will require advance reservations through our online booking system. Walk-in requests will be accommodated only if space is available. The children's section will maintain its current open-access policy.

Library hours remain unchanged: Monday through Thursday 9 AM to 8 PM, Friday and Saturday 9 AM to 6 PM, Sunday 1 PM to 5 PM.

For more information, contact the information desk at (555) 867-5309.

Question: According to the announcement, what happens to large bags? A) They are prohibited entirely B) They must be checked at the security desk C) They can only be used in study rooms D) They require special permission

Time Goal: Complete reading and answer in under 90 seconds Your Time: __ Answer: B

docs.title: Business Communication Formality:
docs.text:
🔴 MOST FORMAL:
• "It is hereby decreed that..."
• "Pursuant to company policy..."
• "In accordance with regulations..."

🟡 MODERATELY FORMAL:
• "Please be advised that..."
• "We regret to inform you..."
• "Effective immediately..."

🟢 LESS FORMAL:
• "Just a reminder that..."
• "Please note..."
• "We're excited to announce..."

docs.title: Transition & Connector Words:
docs.text:
📝 SEQUENCE:
• First, second, finally
• Initially, subsequently, ultimately
• To begin with, in addition, in conclusion

🔗 CAUSE & EFFECT:
• As a result, consequently, therefore
• Due to, because of, owing to
• This has resulted in, leading to

⏰ TIME RELATIONSHIPS:
• Meanwhile, in the interim, simultaneously  
• Prior to, subsequent to, during
• Until, unless, provided that

docs.title: Reading Errors to Avoid:
docs.text:
❌ Reading word-by-word (too slow)
❌ Getting stuck on unknown vocabulary
❌ Not identifying text type quickly  
❌ Missing key time/date information
❌ Confusing similar details

✅ Success Strategies:
✅ Scan for structure and key information
✅ Use context clues for vocabulary
✅ Identify announcement type immediately
✅ Focus on dates, times, locations
✅ Double-check specific details

docs.title: Answer Choice Traps:
docs.text:
🪤 TRAP: Answers that repeat words from text but are wrong
🪤 TRAP: Answers that are true but don't answer the question
🪤 TRAP: Answers that are logical but not stated
🪤 TRAP: Answers that confuse similar information

🎯 SOLUTION: Always find specific text evidence

docs.title: Progressive Speed Training:
docs.text:
📊 Week 1: Accuracy Focus (Don't worry about speed)
📊 Week 2: Moderate Speed (Balance accuracy with pace)
📊 Week 3: High Speed (Build toward test conditions)

🎯 Target Times:
• Part 6 (16 questions): 10 minutes total
• Part 7 Single passages: 1 minute per question  
• Part 7 Multiple passages: 1.5 minutes per question

docs.title: Scanning Techniques:
docs.text:
👁️ VERTICAL SCANNING:
- Look down center of text for key information
- Stop when you see relevant keywords
- Don't read every line

🎯 KEYWORD SCANNING:  
- Identify 2-3 key terms from question
- Scan quickly to locate these terms
- Read surrounding context carefully

docs.title: Company Internal:
docs.text:
• Policy changes → Look for "effective date"
• Meeting announcements → Focus on time/location
• System maintenance → Note downtime periods  
• Personnel changes → Identify new roles/responsibilities

docs.title: Public Notices:
docs.text:
• Service disruptions → Check duration and alternatives
• Event announcements → Note registration requirements
• Schedule changes → Compare old vs new information
• Emergency notifications → Focus on immediate actions

docs.title: Academic/Institution:
docs.text:
• Course changes → Look for prerequisites/requirements
• Facility updates → Note access restrictions  
• Deadline reminders → Mark specific dates/times
• Registration notices → Check eligibility criteria

docs.title: Day 65: Internal Communications (Giao tiếp nội bộ)
Day 65: Internal Communications (Giao tiếp nội bộ)
docs.text: Chào mừng bạn đến với Ngày 65! Hôm nay chúng ta tiếp tục PHASE 6: READING COMPREHENSION với chủ đề Internal Communications (Giao tiếp nội bộ). Đây là loại văn bản rất quan trọng trong TOEIC, bao gồm memos, company updates, internal policies, và department communications. Bài học này sẽ giúp bạn nắm vững cách đọc hiểu các văn bản giao tiếp trong công ty một cách chuyên nghiệp và hiệu quả.

docs.title: 🎯 Mục tiêu bài học
docs.text:
• Nắm vững 55+ từ vựng về internal communications và company policies.
  • Luyện đọc (Reading): Hiểu sâu internal memos và company updates (Part 6-7).
  • Chiến lược: Master business communication patterns và formal language.
  • Context: Hiểu company culture và workplace dynamics qua văn bản.

docs.title: ⏰ Phân bổ thời gian (1.5 - 2 giờ)
docs.text:
1. Từ vựng (25 phút): Học vocabulary về internal communications.
  2. Memo Structure (20 phút): Hiểu format của business memos.
  3. Policy Language (25 phút): Master formal policy language.
  4. Practice Exercises (30 phút): Luyện tập với authentic company texts.
  5. Advanced Skills (10 phút): Inference và implication trong business context.

docs.title: a. Internal Communication Types (Loại giao tiếp nội bộ)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ memorandum /ˌmeməˈrændəm/ (n) bản ghi nhớ (chính thức) The memorandum outlined new procedures. internal memo /ɪnˈtɜːrnəl ˈmemoʊ/ (n) memo nội bộ An internal memo was circulated yesterday. company update /ˈkʌmpəni ˈʌpdeɪt/ (n) cập nhật công ty Monthly company updates are sent via email. policy document /ˈpɑːləsi ˈdɑːkjəmənt/ (n) văn bản chính sách Review the policy document carefully. directive /dəˈrektɪv/ (n) chỉ thị The new directive takes effect immediately. bulletin /ˈbʊlətən/ (n) bản tin Check the employee bulletin board. circular /ˈsɜːrkjələr/ (n) thông báo vòng A circular was sent to all departments. inter-office communication /ˌɪntər ˈɔːfəs kəˌmjuːnəˈkeɪʃən/ (n) giao tiếp giữa các văn phòng Inter-office communication has improved. department briefing /dɪˈpɑːrtmənt ˈbriːfɪŋ/ (n) briefing phòng ban Attend the department briefing at 3 PM. staff notification /stæf ˌnoʊtəfəˈkeɪʃən/ (n) thông báo nhân viên Staff notification was posted this morning.

docs.title: b. Formal Business Language (Ngôn ngữ kinh doanh chính thức)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ pursuant to /pərˈsuːənt tuː/ Formal theo, căn cứ vào Pursuant to company policy, smoking is prohibited. in accordance with /ɪn əˈkɔːrdəns wɪð/ Formal phù hợp với In accordance with regulations, ID is required. with regard to /wɪð rɪˈɡɑːrd tuː/ Formal liên quan đến With regard to the recent changes... for the purpose of /fɔːr ðə ˈpɜːrpəs ʌv/ Formal với mục đích For the purpose of improving efficiency... it has come to our attention /ɪt hæz kʌm tuː aʊr əˈtenʃən/ Formal chúng tôi nhận thấy It has come to our attention that... we would like to remind /wi wʊd laɪk tuː rɪˈmaɪnd/ Polite chúng tôi muốn nhắc nhở We would like to remind all staff... please be advised /pliːz biː ədˈvaɪzd/ Formal xin được thông báo Please be advised of the schedule change. it is imperative that /ɪt ɪz ɪmˈperətɪv ðæt/ Strong điều quan trọng là It is imperative that safety rules are followed. failure to comply /ˈfeɪljər tuː kəmˈplaɪ/ Warning không tuân thủ Failure to comply may result in disciplinary action. moving forward /ˈmuːvɪŋ ˈfɔːrwərd/ Future từ giờ trở đi Moving forward, new procedures will apply.

docs.title: c. Department & Organizational Terms (Từ vựng tổ chức)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ management /ˈmænədʒmənt/ (n) ban quản lý Management has decided to restructure. administration /ədˌmɪnəˈstreɪʃən/ (n) ban hành chính Administration will handle payroll issues. executive team /ɪɡˈzekjətɪv tiːm/ (n) đội ngũ điều hành The executive team met yesterday. board of directors /bɔːrd ʌv dəˈrektərz/ (n) hội đồng quản trị The board of directors approved the budget. senior leadership /ˈsiːnjər ˈliːdərʃɪp/ (n) lãnh đạo cấp cao Senior leadership supports this initiative. middle management /ˈmɪdəl ˈmænədʒmənt/ (n) quản lý tầm trung Middle management will implement changes. department head /dɪˈpɑːrtmənt hed/ (n) trưởng phòng Each department head received the memo. team leader /tiːm ˈliːdər/ (n) trưởng nhóm Team leaders will brief their staff. supervisor /ˈsuːpərvaɪzər/ (n) giám sát viên Contact your supervisor for clarification. coordinator /koʊˈɔːrdəneɪtər/ (n) điều phối viên The project coordinator sent updates. liaison /ˈliːəzɑːn/ (n) người liên lạc She serves as liaison between departments. stakeholder /ˈsteɪkhoʊldər/ (n) bên liên quan All stakeholders were informed of changes.

docs.title: d. Policy & Procedure Language (Ngôn ngữ chính sách)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ mandate /ˈmændeɪt/ (n/v) lệnh/ra lệnh The new safety mandate is effective today. stipulate /ˈstɪpjəleɪt/ (v) quy định The contract stipulates clear guidelines. enforce /ɪnˈfɔːrs/ (v) thực thi Security will enforce the new policy. implement /ˈɪmpləmənt/ (v) thực hiện We will implement changes gradually. compliance /kəmˈplaɪəns/ (n) sự tuân thủ Ensure full compliance with regulations. adherence /ədˈhɪrəns/ (n) sự tuân theo Adherence to safety protocols is mandatory. violation /ˌvaɪəˈleɪʃən/ (n) vi phạm Any policy violation will be documented. infringement /ɪnˈfrɪndʒmənt/ (n) sự vi phạm Copyright infringement is strictly prohibited. breach /briːtʃ/ (n) sự vi phạm Security breach incidents must be reported. disciplinary action /ˈdɪsəpləneri ˈækʃən/ (n) hành động kỷ luật Disciplinary action may be taken. repercussion /ˌriːpərˈkʌʃən/ (n) hậu quả Understand the repercussions of non-compliance. accountability /əˌkaʊntəˈbɪləti/ (n) trách nhiệm giải trình All employees have accountability for safety.

docs.title: e. Change & Update Vocabulary (Từ vựng thay đổi)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ restructure /riːˈstrʌktʃər/ (v) tái cấu trúc The company will restructure operations. reorganize /riːˈɔːrɡənaɪz/ (v) tổ chức lại We need to reorganize the department. revise /rɪˈvaɪz/ (v) xem xét lại The policy will be revised annually. modify /ˈmɑːdəfaɪ/ (v) sửa đổi We will modify the current procedure. update /ˈʌpdeɪt/ (v) cập nhật Please update your contact information. transition /trænˈzɪʃən/ (n/v) chuyển đổi The transition will take six months. migration /maɪˈɡreɪʃən/ (n) di chuyển Data migration is scheduled for weekend. rollout /ˈroʊlaʊt/ (n) triển khai The software rollout begins Monday. phase-in /feɪz ɪn/ (v) triển khai từng giai đoạn New benefits will be phased in gradually. discontinue /ˌdɪskənˈtɪnjuː/ (v) ngừng We will discontinue the old system. streamline /ˈstriːmlaɪn/ (v) tinh gọn Management wants to streamline processes. optimize /ˈɑːptəmaɪz/ (v) tối ưu hóa We aim to optimize workflow efficiency.

docs.title: Standard Memo Format:
docs.text:
MEMORANDUM

TO: [Recipients]

docs.text:
📢 COMPANY UPDATE

[Key announcements/changes]

docs.title: Policy Document Structure:
docs.text:
📋 POLICY: [Title]
🎯 PURPOSE: [Why this policy exists]

📞 CONTACT: [Questions/clarification]
📅 EFFECTIVE DATE: [When it starts]

docs.title: Sample 1: Department Restructuring Memo
docs.text:
MEMORANDUM

TO: All Marketing Department Staff
FROM: Jennifer Walsh, VP Marketing  
DATE: November 15, 2024
RE: Department Restructuring Effective January 1, 2025

I am writing to inform you of important organizational changes that will take effect at the beginning of the new year.

Effective January 1, 2025, the Marketing Department will be restructured into three specialized divisions:

• Digital Marketing (Social Media, SEO, Online Advertising)
• Traditional Marketing (Print, Radio, Events)  
• Market Research (Analytics, Customer Insights, Trends)

Each division will be led by a newly appointed director who will report directly to my office. Current team members will be assigned to divisions based on their expertise and interests. Individual meetings will be scheduled during December to discuss placement options.

This restructuring aims to improve focus, efficiency, and career development opportunities within our department. I am confident these changes will strengthen our competitive position and better serve our clients.

For questions about this transition, please contact me directly at extension 4521 or email jwalshe@company.com.

Best regards,
Jennifer Walsh

docs.title: Sample 2: IT Security Policy Update
docs.text:
COMPANY POLICY UPDATE

TO: All Employees
FROM: IT Security Department
DATE: October 30, 2024
SUBJECT: Enhanced Cybersecurity Measures

In light of recent security incidents across our industry, we are implementing enhanced cybersecurity measures to protect our company data and systems.

EFFECTIVE NOVEMBER 15, 2024:

1. PASSWORD REQUIREMENTS
   • Passwords must be changed every 90 days (previously 180 days)
   • Minimum 12 characters with special symbols required
   • Cannot reuse any of the last 10 passwords

2. TWO-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION  
   • Mandatory for all email accounts and business applications
   • Authenticator app required (company will provide setup assistance)

3. USB DEVICE RESTRICTIONS
   • Personal USB devices are no longer permitted
   • Company-issued encrypted USBs available upon request

4. REMOTE ACCESS CHANGES
   • VPN connection required for all remote work
   • Remote desktop sessions limited to 8 hours maximum

Training sessions will be conducted from November 1-14 to ensure smooth transition. Attendance is mandatory for all staff.

Non-compliance with these security measures may result in account suspension and disciplinary action.

For technical support, contact IT Helpdesk at ext. 2200.

IT Security Team

docs.title: Part 6: Memo Completion Strategy
docs.text:
🎯 MEMO-SPECIFIC APPROACH:

1. IDENTIFY MEMO ELEMENTS (10 seconds)
   - TO/FROM/DATE/RE fields
   - Formal vs. informal tone
   - Department/company context

2. ANALYZE BLANK CONTEXT (25 seconds per blank)
   - Business logic and flow
   - Formal language patterns
   - Policy/procedure language

3. VERIFY BUSINESS APPROPRIATENESS (5 seconds)
   - Does it fit company culture?
   - Is the tone consistent?
   - Does it make business sense?

docs.title: Part 7: Policy Comprehension Strategy
docs.text:
📝 POLICY-FOCUSED READING:

1. SCAN FOR STRUCTURE (20 seconds)
   - Policy purpose and scope
   - Effective dates and deadlines  
   - Action items and requirements

2. LOCATE SPECIFIC INFORMATION (45 seconds)
   - Who is affected?
   - What changes are being made?
   - When do changes take effect?
   - What are the consequences?

3. UNDERSTAND IMPLICATIONS (30 seconds)
   - What does this mean for employees?
   - What actions are required?
   - What happens if not followed?

docs.title: Common Internal Communication Question Types:
docs.text: Question Pattern Focus Area Example Purpose questions Why memo was written "What is the main purpose of this memo?" Detail questions Specific policy points "When does the new policy take effect?" Scope questions Who is affected "Which employees must attend training?" Procedure questions How to comply "What steps must employees take?" Consequence questions Results of non-compliance "What happens if deadlines are missed?"

docs.title: Exercise A: Memo Completion (Part 6 Style)
docs.text:
Complete this internal memo by choosing the best option for each blank:

MEMORANDUM

TO: All Department Managers
FROM: Human Resources
DATE: December 1, 2024
RE: Annual Performance Review Process

As we approach year-end, it is time to begin our annual performance review process. __(1)__ with our commitment to employee development, this year's reviews will include enhanced goal-setting components.

All managers must complete their team's performance evaluations __(2)__ January 15, 2025. The new online system will be available starting December 10th, and training sessions are scheduled for December 12-14.

__(3)__ to participate in training will receive individual coaching from HR representatives. We strongly encourage all managers to attend these sessions to familiarize themselves with the updated evaluation criteria.

For questions about the new process, please contact the HR department at extension 3400.

Human Resources Department

Question 1: A) Consistent B) Consistently C) In consistency D) According

Question 2: A) until B) by C) during D) from

Question 3: A) Managers who are unable B) Managers unable C) Any manager unable D) Those managers unable

Answer Key: 1-A, 2-B, 3-A

docs.title: Exercise B: Policy Comprehension (Part 7 Style)
docs.text:
Read this policy update and answer the questions:

COMPANY POLICY UPDATE: FLEXIBLE WORK ARRANGEMENTS

Effective March 1, 2025, our company will implement a new flexible work policy to support work-life balance and employee satisfaction.

ELIGIBILITY:
• Full-time employees with at least one year of service
• Employees with satisfactory performance ratings
• Positions that can be performed remotely (as determined by department heads)

OPTIONS AVAILABLE:
1. Hybrid Schedule: Work from office 3 days, home 2 days per week
2. Compressed Workweek: Four 10-hour days instead of five 8-hour days  
3. Flexible Hours: Adjust start/end times within core hours (10 AM - 3 PM)

APPLICATION PROCESS:
Employees must submit a flexible work request form to their direct supervisor by February 1, 2025. Requests will be reviewed based on job requirements, team needs, and operational demands. Approval is not guaranteed and arrangements may be modified or terminated based on performance or business needs.

TRIAL PERIOD:
All approved flexible arrangements will have a 90-day trial period. Performance will be monitored closely, and arrangements may be adjusted based on productivity and team collaboration effectiveness.

For questions, contact HR at flexwork@company.com.

Questions:

  1. Who is eligible for flexible work arrangements? A) All employees regardless of tenure B) Part-time employees with good performance C) Full-time employees with one year service and good performance D) Only managers and senior staff

  2. When must employees submit their requests? A) March 1, 2025 B) February 1, 2025 C) After the policy takes effect D) During their performance review

  3. What happens during the trial period? A) Employees can change their arrangement freely B) Performance is monitored and arrangements may be adjusted C) All arrangements become permanent D) Employees must reapply for continuation

  4. Which work option allows employees to work only four days? A) Hybrid Schedule B) Flexible Hours C) Compressed Workweek D) Remote Work

Answer Key: 1-C, 2-B, 3-B, 4-C

docs.title: Exercise C: Business Context Understanding
docs.text:
Read this company update and identify the implied meanings:

QUARTERLY COMPANY UPDATE

Team,

As we close Q3, I want to share some important updates about our company's direction.

FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE: While we faced some headwinds this quarter, our core business remains strong. Revenue decreased by 8% compared to Q2, primarily due to seasonal market fluctuations and supply chain challenges that affected product availability.

ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGES: To better position ourselves for Q4 and beyond, we are implementing some strategic adjustments. The Marketing and Sales departments will be merged under new leadership to create more synergy and eliminate redundancies.

FUTURE OUTLOOK: We remain optimistic about our prospects and continue investing in innovation and employee development. However, we must be prudent with our resources as we navigate the current economic climate.

Thank you for your continued dedication during this transition period.

Sarah Chen, CEO

Inference Questions: 1. What does "headwinds" likely refer to? 2. What does "strategic adjustments" probably mean? 3. What does "be prudent with resources" suggest?

Sample Answers: 1. Business challenges/difficulties 2. Cost-cutting measures/restructuring 3. Careful spending/potential budget cuts

docs.title: Reading Between the Lines:
docs.text:
🔍 EUPHEMISMS IN BUSINESS:
• "Right-sizing" = Layoffs/downsizing
• "Strategic restructuring" = Budget cuts  
• "Streamlining operations" = Eliminating positions
• "Optimizing resources" = Reducing costs
• "Transition period" = Uncertain/changing times

🎯 POSITIVE SPIN LANGUAGE:
• "Enhanced focus" = Narrowed scope/limited resources
• "Improved efficiency" = Doing more with less
• "Strategic partnership" = Merger/acquisition  
• "New opportunities" = Major changes coming
• "Exciting challenges" = Difficult situations

docs.title: Tone and Formality Levels:
docs.text:
🔴 VERY FORMAL (Policies, Legal):
• "Pursuant to regulations..."
• "In accordance with..."
• "Failure to comply may result in..."

🟡 BUSINESS FORMAL (Standard memos):
• "Please be advised..."
• "We would like to inform..."
• "Moving forward..."

🟢 BUSINESS CASUAL (Updates, announcements):
• "We're excited to share..."
• "Just a quick reminder..."
• "Thanks for your patience..."

docs.title: Change Announcements Pattern:
docs.text:
1. CONTEXT: Current situation/reason for change
2. ANNOUNCEMENT: What is changing
3. DETAILS: Specific information (dates, procedures)
4. IMPACT: How it affects employees  
5. ACTION: What employees need to do
6. SUPPORT: Where to get help/information

docs.title: Policy Updates Pattern:
docs.text:
1. POLICY TITLE: Clear identification
2. PURPOSE: Why this policy exists
3. SCOPE: Who it applies to
4. REQUIREMENTS: What must be done
5. PROCEDURES: How to comply
6. CONSEQUENCES: What happens if violated
7. EFFECTIVE DATE: When it starts

docs.title: Meeting/Event Announcements:
docs.text:
1. WHAT: Type of meeting/event
2. WHEN: Date and time
3. WHERE: Location (physical/virtual)  
4. WHO: Required attendees
5. WHY: Purpose/agenda items
6. PREPARATION: What to bring/review
7. CONTACT: Questions/RSVP information

docs.title: Scanning Priorities:
docs.text:
👁️ SCAN FOR:
1. Dates and deadlines (highest priority)
2. Action items and requirements  
3. People affected (departments, roles)
4. Consequences and implications
5. Contact information

⚡ SPEED TECHNIQUES:
• Read first and last paragraphs completely
• Scan middle paragraphs for key information
• Look for numbered/bulleted lists  
• Focus on bold/emphasized text
• Skip excessive background information

docs.title: Time Management:
docs.text:
📊 TARGET TIMES:
• Part 6 memo completion: 1.5 minutes per text
• Part 7 policy comprehension: 2 minutes per passage
• Multiple-choice questions: 45 seconds each

🎯 EFFICIENCY TIPS:
• Don't read every word
• Use document structure as a guide
• Answer what you can, guess the rest
• Don't get stuck on difficult vocabulary

docs.title: Day 66: Schedules & Timetables (Lịch trình và Thời gian biểu)
Day 66: Schedules & Timetables (Lịch trình và Thời gian biểu)
docs.text: Chào mừng bạn đến với Ngày 66! Hôm nay chúng ta tiếp tục PHASE 6: READING COMPREHENSION với chủ đề Schedules & Timetables (Lịch trình và Thời gian biểu). Đây là dạng văn bản chứa nhiều data và thông tin số trong TOEIC Part 6-7, bao gồm meeting agendas, event schedules, transportation timetables, và work schedules. Bài học này sẽ giúp bạn nắm vững kỹ năng data extraction và time management information.

docs.title: 🎯 Mục tiêu bài học
docs.text:
• Nắm vững 50+ từ vựng về schedules, timetables và time management.
  • Luyện đọc (Reading): Data extraction từ complex schedules (Part 6-7).
  • Chiến lược: Quick scanning cho time-related information.
  • Skills: Interpret charts, tables, và calendar formats.

docs.title: ⏰ Phân bổ thời gian (1.5 - 2 giờ)
docs.text:
1. Từ vựng (25 phút): Học vocabulary về schedules và time management.
  2. Data Formats (20 phút): Hiểu various schedule formats và layouts.
  3. Scanning Skills (25 phút): Master quick data location techniques.
  4. Practice Exercises (30 phút): Luyện tập với complex timetables.
  5. Speed Challenge (10 phút): Timed data extraction practice.

docs.title: a. Schedule Types & Formats (Loại lịch trình)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ agenda /əˈdʒendə/ (n) chương trình nghị sự Review the meeting agenda beforehand. itinerary /aɪˈtɪnəreri/ (n) hành trình The travel itinerary includes three cities. timetable /ˈtaɪmˌteɪbəl/ (n) thời gian biểu Check the train timetable for departures. calendar /ˈkæləndər/ (n) lịch Mark important dates on your calendar. schedule /ˈskedʒuːl/ (n) lịch trình The production schedule is very tight. roster /ˈrɑːstər/ (n) danh sách ca trực The duty roster is posted weekly. timeline /ˈtaɪmlaɪn/ (n) mốc thời gian The project timeline spans six months. program /ˈproʊɡræm/ (n) chương trình The conference program is now available. lineup /ˈlaɪnʌp/ (n) danh sách sắp xếp The speaker lineup is impressive. slot /slɑːt/ (n) khung giờ Reserve a time slot for your presentation.

docs.title: b. Time Expressions & Periods (Biểu thức thời gian)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ from [time] to [time] /frʌm tuː/ Duration từ [giờ] đến [giờ] From 9 AM to 5 PM daily. between [time] and [time] /bɪˈtwiːn ænd/ Duration từ [giờ] đến [giờ] Between 1 PM and 3 PM. every [period] /ˈevri/ Frequency mỗi [khoảng thời gian] Every 30 minutes throughout the day. at [specific time] /æt/ Exact time vào lúc [giờ cụ thể] At exactly 2:15 PM. by [deadline] /baɪ/ Deadline trước [thời hạn] Submit by end of business day. no later than /noʊ ˈleɪtər ðæn/ Deadline không muộn hơn No later than Friday noon. as of [date] /æz ʌv/ Starting kể từ [ngày] As of Monday, new hours apply. through [end date] /θruː/ Duration đến hết [ngày] Through December 31st only. during [period] /ˈdʊrɪŋ/ Time span trong suốt [khoảng] During lunch hours (12-1 PM). around [approximate time] /əˈraʊnd/ Approximate khoảng [giờ] Around 4:30 PM approximately.

docs.title: c. Meeting & Event Vocabulary (Từ vựng cuộc họp)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ session /ˈseʃən/ (n) phiên họp The afternoon session starts at 2 PM. keynote /ˈkiːnoʊt/ (n) bài phát biểu chính The keynote address opens the conference. breakout /ˈbreɪkaʊt/ (n) nhóm nhỏ Breakout sessions run simultaneously. workshop /ˈwɜːrkʃɑːp/ (n) hội thảo thực hành Interactive workshops follow presentations. panel /ˈpænəl/ (n) hội đồng thảo luận The expert panel discusses current trends. presentation /ˌprezənˈteɪʃən/ (n) bài thuyết trình Each presentation lasts 45 minutes. briefing /ˈbriːfɪŋ/ (n) buổi briefing Morning briefings are mandatory. debriefing /ˌdiːˈbriːfɪŋ/ (n) buổi tổng kết Project debriefing concludes the day. networking /ˈnetwɜːrkɪŋ/ (n) giao lưu Networking sessions build relationships. reception /rɪˈsepʃən/ (n) tiệc chào đón The welcome reception starts at 6 PM. break /breɪk/ (n) giờ nghỉ Coffee breaks are scheduled every 2 hours. intermission /ˌɪntərˈmɪʃən/ (n) giờ nghỉ giữa chương trình A 15-minute intermission is planned.

docs.title: d. Transportation & Travel Schedules (Lịch trình giao thông)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ departure /dɪˈpɑːrtʃər/ (n) khởi hành The departure time is 8:30 AM. arrival /əˈraɪvəl/ (n) đến nơi Expected arrival is 11:45 AM. layover /ˈleɪoʊvər/ (n) dừng chân There's a 2-hour layover in Chicago. connection /kəˈnekʃən/ (n) chuyến nối Make your connection at Gate B12. delay /dɪˈleɪ/ (n/v) trì hoãn Flight delays are possible due to weather. cancellation /ˌkænsəˈleɪʃən/ (n) hủy bỏ Check for cancellations before traveling. gate /ɡeɪt/ (n) cửa ra máy bay Boarding at Gate A7 begins at 7:15. platform /ˈplætfɔːrm/ (n) sân ga The train departs from Platform 3. terminal /ˈtɜːrmənəl/ (n) nhà ga International flights use Terminal 2. route /ruːt/ (n) tuyến đường This route has multiple stops. frequency /ˈfriːkwənsi/ (n) tần suất Buses run with high frequency. express /ɪkˈspres/ (adj) tốc hành Express services skip intermediate stops.

docs.title: e. Work Schedule Terms (Từ vựng lịch làm việc)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ shift /ʃɪft/ (n) ca làm việc The night shift starts at 11 PM. rotation /roʊˈteɪʃən/ (n) luân phiên Staff work on a rotating schedule. coverage /ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/ (n) phủ sóng ca trực Ensure 24-hour coverage is maintained. overtime /ˈoʊvərtaɪm/ (n) làm thêm giờ Overtime is available on weekends. break time /breɪk taɪm/ (n) giờ nghỉ Break times are staggered throughout shifts. lunch hour /lʌntʃ aʊər/ (n) giờ ăn trưa Lunch hours vary by department. clocking in/out /ˈklɑːkɪŋ ɪn aʊt/ (v) chấm công vào/ra Remember to clock in before starting work. attendance /əˈtendəns/ (n) sự có mặt Perfect attendance earns bonuses. absence /ˈæbsəns/ (n) vắng mặt Report any absences to supervisors. substitute /ˈsʌbstətuːt/ (n) người thay thế Find a substitute for your shift. on-call /ɑːn kɔːl/ (adj) trực chờ On-call staff must be reachable. flexible hours /ˈfleksəbəl aʊərz/ (n) giờ linh hoạt Flexible hours improve work-life balance.

docs.title: f. Scheduling Actions & Changes (Hành động lên lịch)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ reschedule /riːˈskedʒuːl/ (v) lên lịch lại We need to reschedule the meeting. postpone /poʊsˈpoʊn/ (v) hoãn lại The event is postponed until next month. advance /ædˈvæns/ (v) dời sớm lại Can we advance the deadline? extend /ɪkˈstend/ (v) gia hạn The deadline has been extended. overlap /ˈoʊvərlæp/ (v/n) chồng chéo Schedule overlaps create conflicts. coordinate /koʊˈɔːrdəneɪt/ (v) phối hợp Coordinate schedules with all participants. synchronize /ˈsɪŋkrənaɪz/ (v) đồng bộ Synchronize calendars across devices. allocate /ˈæləkeɪt/ (v) phân bổ Allocate sufficient time for each task. block /blɑːk/ (v) chặn thời gian Block time for important projects. reserve /rɪˈzɜːrv/ (v) đặt trước Reserve conference rooms in advance. confirm /kənˈfɜːrm/ (v) xác nhận Confirm attendance by Friday. notify /ˈnoʊtəfaɪ/ (v) thông báo Notify participants of any changes.

docs.title: Quick Scanning Technique:
docs.text:
👁️ SCANNING PRIORITIES:

1. TIME INFORMATION (Highest Priority)
   - Start/end times
   - Duration periods  
   - Deadlines and cutoffs
   - Frequency patterns

2. LOCATION DETAILS
   - Room numbers/names
   - Venue changes
   - Platform/gate info
   - Remote access options

3. PEOPLE & PARTICIPANTS
   - Speakers/presenters
   - Required attendees
   - Contact persons
   - Capacity limits

4. ACTION ITEMS
   - What needs to be done
   - Registration requirements
   - Preparation needs
   - Follow-up tasks

docs.title: Part 6: Schedule Completion Strategy:
docs.text:
📝 SCHEDULE-SPECIFIC APPROACH:

1. IDENTIFY SCHEDULE TYPE (10 seconds)
   - Meeting agenda vs. transportation vs. event
   - Formal vs. informal format
   - Internal vs. public information

2. UNDERSTAND TIME FLOW (20 seconds)
   - Chronological sequence
   - Duration patterns
   - Break/transition periods

3. COMPLETE WITH LOGIC (25 seconds per blank)
   - Time consistency
   - Logical progression  
   - Format matching

docs.title: Part 7: Schedule Questions Strategy:
docs.text:
🔍 DATA-FOCUSED READING:

1. QUESTION ANALYSIS (15 seconds)
   - What specific information needed?
   - Time, location, person, or process?
   - Multiple data points required?

2. TARGETED SCANNING (30 seconds)
   - Go directly to relevant section
   - Look for numbers, times, names
   - Check headings and subheadings

3. CROSS-REFERENCE VERIFICATION (15 seconds)
   - Confirm information accuracy
   - Check for exceptions or changes
   - Verify time zones or special notes

docs.title: Scanning Patterns:
docs.text:
📊 VERTICAL SCANNING:
- Look down time columns first
- Scan for specific times/dates
- Notice patterns and exceptions

🔍 HORIZONTAL SCANNING:  
- Follow rows for related information
- Track across multiple time periods
- Compare parallel activities

📋 GRID READING:
- Intersection of row/column data
- Cross-reference multiple variables
- Identify conflicts or gaps

docs.title: Time Management Tips:
docs.text:
⏰ EFFICIENCY TECHNIQUES:
• Don't read every detail
• Focus on question requirements
• Use headers and labels as guides
• Look for bold/highlighted information
• Skip irrelevant sections quickly

🎯 TARGET TIMES:
• Simple schedule questions: 30 seconds
• Complex timetable questions: 45 seconds
• Multi-step data extraction: 60 seconds

docs.title: Detail Questions:
docs.text:
🔍 "What time does...?" → Look for specific times
🔍 "Who is scheduled for...?" → Find names in time slots
🔍 "How long is...?" → Calculate duration
🔍 "Where does... take place?" → Locate venue information

docs.title: Comparison Questions:
docs.text:
⚖️ "Which day has more...?" → Compare quantities
⚖️ "What is the difference between...?" → Calculate variations
⚖️ "Which option is longer/shorter?" → Compare durations

docs.title: Inference Questions:
docs.text:
🧠 "If someone arrives at..., when will...?" → Calculate based on schedule
🧠 "What can be concluded about...?" → Analyze patterns
🧠 "Based on the schedule, what is likely...?" → Logical deduction
