docs.title: Day 67: Instructions & Procedures (Hướng dẫn và Quy trình)
Day 67: Instructions & Procedures (Hướng dẫn và Quy trình)
docs.text: Chào mừng bạn đến với Ngày 67! Hôm nay chúng ta tiếp tục PHASE 6: READING COMPREHENSION với chủ đề Instructions & Procedures (Hướng dẫn và Quy trình). Đây là dạng văn bản rất quan trọng trong TOEIC Part 6-7, bao gồm technical manuals, how-to guides, safety procedures, và step-by-step instructions. Bài học này sẽ giúp bạn nắm vững sequential reading và process comprehension skills.

docs.title: 🎯 Mục tiêu bài học
docs.text:
• Nắm vững 55+ từ vựng về instructions, procedures và processes.
  • Luyện đọc (Reading): Sequential understanding và process analysis (Part 6-7).
  • Chiến lược: Master step-by-step comprehension techniques.
  • Skills: Interpret technical language và procedural writing.

docs.title: ⏰ Phân bổ thời gian (1.5 - 2 giờ)
docs.text:
1. Từ vựng (25 phút): Học vocabulary về instructions và procedures.
  2. Process Structure (20 phút): Hiểu sequential writing patterns.
  3. Technical Language (25 phút): Master formal instruction language.
  4. Practice Exercises (30 phút): Luyện tập với complex procedures.
  5. Troubleshooting Skills (10 phút): Problem-solving trong instructions.

docs.title: a. Instruction Types & Formats (Loại hướng dẫn)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ manual /ˈmænjuəl/ (n) sách hướng dẫn Consult the user manual for details. guideline /ˈɡaɪdlaɪn/ (n) hướng dẫn Follow safety guidelines strictly. procedure /prəˈsiːdʒər/ (n) quy trình The evacuation procedure is posted. protocol /ˈproʊtəkɔːl/ (n) quy tắc Medical protocols must be followed. instruction /ɪnˈstrʌkʃən/ (n) chỉ dẫn Read instructions before assembly. directive /dəˈrektɪv/ (n) chỉ thị New safety directives are mandatory. specification /ˌspesəfəˈkeɪʃən/ (n) thông số kỹ thuật Check technical specifications first. tutorial /tuːˈtɔːriəl/ (n) hướng dẫn học Complete the online tutorial. walkthrough /ˈwɔːkθruː/ (n) hướng dẫn từng bước The software walkthrough helps users. checklist /ˈtʃeklɪst/ (n) danh sách kiểm tra Use the pre-flight checklist.

docs.title: b. Sequential Language (Ngôn ngữ tuần tự)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ first /fɜːrst/ Sequence đầu tiên First, turn off the power supply. next /nekst/ Sequence tiếp theo Next, remove the cover panel. then /ðen/ Sequence sau đó Then connect the cables carefully. after that /ˈæftər ðæt/ Sequence sau đó After that, test the connection. subsequently /ˈsʌbsəkwəntli/ Sequence tiếp theo đó Subsequently, run diagnostic tests. meanwhile /ˈmiːnwaɪl/ Parallel trong lúc đó Meanwhile, prepare the backup system. simultaneously /ˌsaɪməlˈteɪniəsli/ Parallel đồng thời Press both buttons simultaneously. before /bɪˈfɔːr/ Prior trước khi Before starting, read all warnings. prior to /ˈpraɪər tuː/ Prior trước khi Prior to installation, check compatibility. finally /ˈfaɪnəli/ Conclusion cuối cùng Finally, restart the system.

docs.title: c. Action Verbs for Procedures (Động từ hành động)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ activate /ˈæktəveɪt/ (v) kích hoạt Activate the emergency system. configure /kənˈfɪɡjər/ (v) cấu hình Configure the network settings. initialize /ɪˈnɪʃəlaɪz/ (v) khởi tạo Initialize the software setup. execute /ˈeksəkjuːt/ (v) thực hiện Execute the backup procedure. terminate /ˈtɜːrmɪneɪt/ (v) chấm dứt Terminate all running processes. verify /ˈverɪfaɪ/ (v) xác minh Verify that settings are correct. calibrate /ˈkæləbreɪt/ (v) hiệu chỉnh Calibrate the measuring device. synchronize /ˈsɪŋkrənaɪz/ (v) đồng bộ Synchronize data across systems. troubleshoot /ˈtrʌbəlʃuːt/ (v) khắc phục sự cố Troubleshoot connection problems. override /ˌoʊvərˈraɪd/ (v) ghi đè Override automatic settings if needed. reset /riːˈset/ (v) đặt lại Reset the device to factory defaults. upgrade /ˈʌpɡreɪd/ (v) nâng cấp Upgrade software to latest version.

docs.title: d. Technical Equipment Terms (Thuật ngữ thiết bị)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ component /kəmˈpoʊnənt/ (n) thành phần Each component must be tested. circuit /ˈsɜːrkət/ (n) mạch điện Check all circuit connections. interface /ˈɪntərfeɪs/ (n) giao diện Use the graphical user interface. terminal /ˈtɜːrmənəl/ (n) đầu cuối Connect cables to proper terminals. sensor /ˈsensər/ (n) cảm biến Temperature sensors monitor conditions. actuator /ˈæktʃueɪtər/ (n) bộ truyền động Actuators control mechanical movement. module /ˈmɑːdʒuːl/ (n) mô-đun Replace the defective module. assembly /əˈsembli/ (n) cụm lắp ráp The valve assembly needs adjustment. mechanism /ˈmekənɪzəm/ (n) cơ chế The locking mechanism is jammed. apparatus /ˌæpəˈrætəs/ (n) thiết bị Laboratory apparatus requires calibration. fixture /ˈfɪkstʃər/ (n) đồ gá Secure parts in the test fixture. parameter /pəˈræmətər/ (n) thông số Adjust operating parameters carefully.

docs.title: e. Safety & Warning Language (Ngôn ngữ an toàn)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ CAUTION: /ˈkɔːʃən/ Warning THẬN TRỌNG: CAUTION: High voltage present. WARNING: /ˈwɔːrnɪŋ/ Warning CẢNH BÁO: WARNING: Do not exceed limits. DANGER: /ˈdeɪndʒər/ Warning NGUY HIỂM: DANGER: Explosive materials. docs.title: f. Problem-Solving Language (Ngôn ngữ giải quyết vấn đề)

docs.title: Exercise A: Technical Procedure Completion (Part 6 Style)
docs.text:
Complete this equipment installation guide:

NETWORK ROUTER INSTALLATION PROCEDURE

BEFORE YOU BEGIN:
Ensure that you have administrator access and that the network is properly configured. __(1)__ power to all connected devices before starting the installation process.

INSTALLATION STEPS:

1. Position the router in a well-ventilated area away from direct sunlight and heat sources.

2. Connect the power cable to the router and plug it into a grounded electrical outlet. The power LED should __(2)__ within 30 seconds.

3. Use an Ethernet cable to connect your computer directly to Port 1 on the router. __(3)__ for the connection LED to indicate a successful link.

4. Open your web browser and navigate to 192.168.1.1 to access the configuration interface.

5. Follow the setup wizard to complete the initial configuration.

IMPORTANT: Do not disconnect power during the configuration process, as this may corrupt the device settings.

Question 1: A) Disconnect B) Reduce C) Maintain D) Increase

Question 2: A) illuminate B) illuminate C) be illuminated D) illuminating

Question 3: A) Look B) Wait C) Check D) Search

Answer Key: 1-A, 2-A, 3-B

docs.title: Exercise B: Safety Procedure Comprehension (Part 7 Style)
docs.text:
Read this emergency procedure and answer questions:

FIRE EVACUATION PROCEDURE - BUILDING A

IN CASE OF FIRE ALARM:

IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:
1. Stop work immediately and remain calm
2. If you discover a fire, activate the nearest fire alarm
3. Do not attempt to fight the fire unless properly trained
4. Close doors behind you as you evacuate (do not lock)
5. Use stairwells only - never use elevators during evacuation

EVACUATION ROUTE:
• Floors 1-5: Exit via Stairwell A (east side) or Stairwell B (west side)
• Floors 6-10: Exit via Stairwell C (center) - Stairwell A may be congested
• Basement levels: Exit through emergency tunnel to Building B

ASSEMBLY POINTS:
• Main building occupants: North parking lot (Area 1)
• Laboratory personnel: South parking lot (Area 2)  
• Visitors: Report to Reception area in North lot

SPECIAL PROCEDURES:
• Disabled persons: Wait at designated refuge areas on each floor
• Floor wardens: Conduct final sweep of assigned areas
• Do not re-enter building until "all clear" is announced by Fire Marshal

EMERGENCY CONTACTS:
Fire Department: 911
Building Security: 555-0199  
Facilities Management: 555-0156

Questions:

  1. What should you do if you discover a fire? A) Try to extinguish it immediately B) Activate the nearest fire alarm C) Call 911 first D) Alert your supervisor

  2. Which stairwell should someone on the 7th floor use? A) Stairwell A only B) Stairwell B only C) Stairwell C (center) D) Any available stairwell

  3. Where should laboratory personnel gather? A) North parking lot (Area 1) B) South parking lot (Area 2) C) Reception area D) Inside Building B

  4. What should floor wardens do? A) Help disabled persons evacuate B) Contact emergency services C) Conduct final area sweeps D) Direct traffic in parking lots

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-C, 3-B, 4-C

docs.title: Exercise C: Troubleshooting Analysis
docs.text:
Study this troubleshooting guide and identify solutions:

PRINTER TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE

PROBLEM: Printer won't turn on
POSSIBLE CAUSES:
• Power cable not connected
• Power outlet not working
• Internal fuse blown
• Power button stuck

SOLUTIONS:
1. Check power cable connections at both printer and wall outlet
2. Test outlet with another device to verify power
3. If fuse is blown, contact technical support for replacement
4. Press power button firmly - clean around button if sticky

PROBLEM: Poor print quality
POSSIBLE CAUSES:
• Low ink/toner levels
• Dirty print heads  
• Wrong paper type selected
• Print heads misaligned

SOLUTIONS:
1. Check ink/toner levels in printer software
2. Run automatic head cleaning cycle (2-3 times if needed)
3. Verify paper type matches printer settings
4. Perform automatic alignment through printer menu

PROBLEM: Paper jams frequently
POSSIBLE CAUSES:
• Paper loaded incorrectly
• Using wrong paper size
• Paper tray overfilled
• Damaged paper guides

SOLUTIONS:
1. Remove all paper and reload according to guide markers
2. Check paper size settings match actual paper loaded
3. Don't exceed maximum capacity lines in paper tray
4. Inspect and adjust paper guides - replace if damaged

Quick Analysis Questions: 1. If printer turns on but print quality is poor, what should you check first? 2. What's the maximum number of head cleaning cycles recommended? 3. If paper jams occur, what's the first solution to try?

Answers: 1-Ink/toner levels, 2-2-3 times, 3-Remove and reload paper correctly

docs.title: Conditional Instructions:
docs.text:
🔧 IF/THEN PATTERNS:
• "If the LED is red, then restart the system"
• "If temperature exceeds 70°C, then activate cooling"
• "If error message appears, then check connections"

📊 UNLESS STATEMENTS:
• "Do not proceed unless safety is confirmed"
• "System won't start unless password is entered"
• "Unless specified otherwise, use default settings"

⚠️ WARNING CONDITIONS:
• "Should the alarm sound, evacuate immediately"
• "In the event of power failure, use backup procedure"
• "When pressure drops below minimum, shut down system"

docs.text:
📏 EXACT MEASUREMENTS:
• "Torque to exactly 25 Nm"
• "Maintain temperature at 68°F ± 2°"
• "Apply pressure of 15-20 PSI"

🎯 SPECIFIC ACTIONS:
• "Rotate clockwise 1/4 turn"
• "Press and hold for 3 seconds"
• "Slide switch to ENABLE position"

📋 VERIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:
• "Confirm green LED is illuminated"
• "Verify that reading shows 100%"
• "Ensure all connections are secure"

docs.title: Scanning Priorities:
docs.text:
👁️ LOOK FOR:
1. Numbered steps (highest priority)
2. Warning/caution statements
3. Required tools/materials
4. Conditional statements (if/then)
5. Verification checkpoints

⚡ SPEED TECHNIQUES:
• Focus on action verbs (install, connect, verify)
• Identify sequence words (first, next, finally)
• Note safety warnings (DANGER, CAUTION)
• Skip detailed explanations for speed
• Use headings to navigate quickly

docs.title: Time Management:
docs.text:
📊 TARGET TIMES:
• Simple instructions: 1 minute per passage
• Complex procedures: 1.5 minutes per passage  
• Technical manuals: 2 minutes per section
• Troubleshooting guides: 45 seconds per problem

🎯 EFFICIENCY TIPS:
• Don't read every word of explanations
• Focus on what, not why
• Use bullet points and lists as guides
• Skip examples unless specifically asked

docs.title: Scanning Priorities:
docs.text:
👁️ LOOK FOR FIRST:
1. Price information (most important for decisions)
2. Offer details (discounts, promotions)
3. Time limitations (deadlines, expiration)
4. Contact information (how to respond)
5. Terms and conditions (restrictions)

⚡ AD READING STRATEGY:
• Headline → Offer → Call-to-action → Fine print
• Skip marketing fluff, focus on facts
• Look for numbers (prices, percentages, dates)
• Identify what action is required

docs.title: Question Approach:
docs.text:
🔍 COMMON AD QUESTION TYPES:

PRICE QUESTIONS:
"How much does...?" → Look for specific prices
"What discount...?" → Find percentage or amount off

OFFER QUESTIONS:  
"What is included...?" → Scan benefit lists
"When does offer expire...?" → Find time limits

CONTACT QUESTIONS:
"How can customers...?" → Locate contact methods
"Where is the business...?" → Find address/location

TERMS QUESTIONS:
"What restrictions...?" → Check fine print
"What conditions...?" → Look for limitations

docs.title: Misleading Information:
docs.text:
🪤 WATCH OUT FOR:
• "Up to X% off" (may be maximum, not typical)
• "Starting at $X" (lowest price, may not be available)
• "Compare at $X" (inflated comparison price)
• "Limited time" (may be extended repeatedly)

✅ LOOK FOR CLARITY:
• Specific prices and discounts
• Clear expiration dates
• Exact terms and conditions
• Real customer reviews

docs.title: Answer Choice Traps:
docs.text:
❌ WRONG ANSWER PATTERNS:
• Prices mentioned but not the asked price
• Benefits listed but not the specific benefit asked
• Contact methods given but not the requested method
• Time periods mentioned but not the relevant timeframe

✅ RIGHT ANSWER CHARACTERISTICS:
• Directly answers the specific question
• Uses information explicitly stated in ad
• Matches the exact details requested
• Found in the relevant section of advertisement

docs.title: a. Review & Feedback Types (Loại đánh giá)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ review /rɪˈvjuː/ (n/v) đánh giá Customer reviews help improve service. feedback /ˈfiːdbæk/ (n) phản hồi We appreciate your honest feedback. testimonial /ˌtestəˈmoʊniəl/ (n) lời chứng thực Read testimonials from satisfied clients. rating /ˈreɪtɪŋ/ (n) xếp hạng The hotel received a 5-star rating. evaluation /ɪˌvæljuˈeɪʃən/ (n) đánh giá Annual performance evaluations are due. assessment /əˈsesmənt/ (n) đánh giá The assessment revealed areas for improvement. critique /krɪˈtiːk/ (n) phê bình The critique was constructive and helpful. opinion /əˈpɪnjən/ (n) ý kiến In my opinion, the service was excellent. comment /ˈkɑːment/ (n/v) bình luận Please leave a comment about your experience. survey /ˈsɜːrveɪ/ (n) khảo sát Complete our customer satisfaction survey.

docs.title: c. Negative Opinion Language (Ngôn ngữ tiêu cực)

docs.title: d. Mixed & Neutral Opinions (Ý kiến trung tính)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ mixed feelings /mɪkst ˈfiːlɪŋz/ Ambivalence cảm xúc lẫn lộn I have mixed feelings about this decision. pros and cons /proʊz ænd kɑːnz/ Balance ưu và nhược điểm Let me outline the pros and cons. room for improvement /ruːm fɔːr ɪmˈpruːvmənt/ Suggestion chỗ để cải thiện There's definitely room for improvement. decent but not great /ˈdiːsənt bʌt nɑːt ɡreɪt/ Moderate khá nhưng không tuyệt The service was decent but not great. average quality /ˈævərɪdʒ ˈkwɑːləti/ Neutral chất lượng trung bình The food was of average quality. could be better /kʊd bi ˈbetər/ Improvement có thể tốt hơn The presentation could be better. satisfactory /ˌsætəsˈfæktəri/ Acceptance chấp nhận được The results were satisfactory overall. has potential /hæz pəˈtenʃəl/ Hope có tiềm năng The concept has potential for success. partially successful /ˈpɑːrʃəli səkˈsesfəl/ Limited success thành công một phần The campaign was partially successful. needs work /niːdz wɜːrk/ Improvement cần cải thiện This area still needs work.

REVIEW 4 - James P. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
"Exceptional device! Upgraded from a 3-year-old phone and the difference is remarkable. Lightning-fast processing, stunning display, and the wireless charging feature is incredibly convenient. The facial recognition works perfectly even in low light. Worth every penny and more. This will definitely be my brand of choice going forward."

Questions:

  1. What aspect does Sarah M. praise most about the phone? A) Battery life B) Camera quality C) Build materials D) Price value

  2. What problem does Mike T. mention? A) Poor camera performance B) Short battery life C) Software glitches D) Overheating issues

  3. What is Lisa K.'s main complaint? A) The phone is too expensive B) Camera quality is poor C) Battery doesn't last as advertised D) Customer service is unresponsive

  4. Which reviewer would definitely buy this brand again? A) Sarah M. B) Mike T. C) Lisa K. D) James P.

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-C, 3-C, 4-D

docs.title: Exercise C: Opinion Analysis Challenge
docs.text:
Analyze the sentiment in these testimonials:

BUSINESS SERVICE TESTIMONIALS

A) "Working with ABC Consulting was transformative for our company. Their strategic insights helped us increase revenue by 40% in just six months. The team was professional, responsive, and delivered exactly what they promised. We've already scheduled our next project with them."

B) "The service was adequate, though not exceptional. They completed the project on time and within budget, but I felt the communication could have been better. Some of their recommendations were helpful, while others seemed generic. I might consider them again for simpler projects."

Classify each testimonial: A) Sentiment: _ | Would recommend: _ B) Sentiment: _ | Would recommend: _ C) Sentiment: _ | Would recommend: _ D) Sentiment: _ | Would recommend: _

docs.title: Credibility Indicators:
docs.text:
✅ TRUSTWORTHY REVIEWS:
• Specific details and examples
• Balanced perspective (pros and cons)
• Verified purchase indicators
• Recent review dates
• Detailed experience descriptions

❌ QUESTIONABLE REVIEWS:
• Overly generic language
• Extreme opinions without explanation
• No specific details mentioned
• Suspicious timing patterns
• Focus only on promotional points

docs.title: Reading Between the Lines:
docs.text:
🔍 HIDDEN MEANINGS:
"It's okay" → Usually means disappointing
"Not bad" → Probably mediocre quality
"Could be worse" → Definitely unsatisfied
"For the price" → Lower expectations due to cost
"If you don't mind..." → Highlighting significant flaw

💡 POSITIVE SUBTLETIES:
"Pleasantly surprised" → Exceeded low expectations
"Can't complain" → Generally satisfied
"Does the job" → Meets basic requirements
"No regrets" → Happy with purchase
"Glad I chose this" → Would buy again

docs.title: Review Patterns:
docs.text:
📈 TREND ANALYSIS:
• Multiple mentions of same issue = real problem
• Consistent praise for specific feature = strength
• Recent reviews vs. older ones = current quality
• Professional vs. casual reviewers = different perspectives
• Price sensitivity mentions = value assessment

docs.title: Scanning Strategy:
docs.text:
👁️ READ FIRST:
1. Star rating (overall satisfaction)
2. Review title (main point)
3. Final sentence (recommendation)
4. First and last paragraphs (summary)
5. Any repeated words (key themes)

⚡ SPEED TECHNIQUE:
• Skip flowery descriptions
• Focus on factual statements
• Look for specific pros/cons
• Identify reviewer's main concern
• Note verification indicators

docs.title: Question Approach:
docs.text:
🔍 COMMON REVIEW QUESTIONS:

OPINION QUESTIONS:
"What does the reviewer think...?" → Look for explicit opinions
"How does X feel about...?" → Find emotional language

DETAIL QUESTIONS:
"What specific problem...?" → Scan for complaint details
"What feature does X praise...?" → Look for positive mentions

RECOMMENDATION QUESTIONS:
"Would the reviewer recommend...?" → Check final conclusions
"What advice does X give...?" → Look for suggestions

docs.title: Reviewer Motivations:
docs.text:
😊 POSITIVE REVIEWERS:
• Want to help others make good choices
• Appreciate good service/products
• Feel obligated after excellent experience
• Seek to support businesses they like

😞 NEGATIVE REVIEWERS:
• Warn others about problems
• Express frustration publicly
• Seek company attention/response
• Feel obligation to share bad experience

🤔 NEUTRAL REVIEWERS:
• Provide balanced perspective
• Share mixed experiences honestly
• Help set realistic expectations
• Focus on specific use cases

docs.title: Reading Reviewer Intent:
docs.text:
🎯 HELPFUL REVIEWERS:
• Give specific examples
• Explain context of use
• Compare to alternatives
• Offer practical advice

⚠️ BIASED REVIEWERS:
• Extreme language without justification
• Focus only on price
• Personal attacks on company/staff
• Unrealistic expectations

docs.title: Standard Application Layout:
docs.text:
📋 HEADER SECTION:
• Form title and purpose
• Instructions and requirements
• Deadline information
• Contact information for questions

👤 PERSONAL INFORMATION:
• Full name and identification

🎓 BACKGROUND SECTIONS:
• Education history
• Employment experience  
• Skills and qualifications
• References and recommendations

📝 SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS:
• Purpose-related questions

• Special circumstances or conditions

✍️ CERTIFICATION SECTION:

• Signature and date
• Notarization if required
• Witness signatures if needed

docs.text:

docs.title: Pre-Reading Survey:
docs.text:

docs.title: Section-by-Section Approach:
docs.text:

3. Note information you need to gather

⚡ EFFICIENCY TIPS:

docs.title: a. Warranty & Guarantee Terms (Thuật ngữ bảo hành)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ warranty /ˈwɔːrənti/ (n) bảo hành The product comes with a two-year warranty. guarantee /ˌɡærənˈtiː/ (n/v) đảm bảo We guarantee satisfaction or money back. coverage /ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/ (n) phạm vi bảo hiểm Extended coverage is available for purchase. protection /prəˈtekʃən/ (n) bảo vệ Additional protection plans are offered. defect /ˈdiːfekt/ (n) khiếm khuyết Manufacturing defects are covered under warranty. malfunction /mælˈfʌŋkʃən/ (n/v) trục trặc Report any malfunction within 30 days. replacement /rɪˈpleɪsmənt/ (n) thay thế Free replacement for defective parts. repair /rɪˈper/ (n/v) sửa chữa Authorized repair centers nationwide. refund /ˈriːfʌnd/ (n/v) hoàn tiền Full refund available within return period. exchange /ɪksˈtʃeɪndʒ/ (n/v) đổi Exchange policy allows 14-day returns.

docs.title: b. Service Agreement Language (Ngôn ngữ thỏa thuận dịch vụ)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ service agreement /ˈsɜːrvəs əˈɡriːmənt/ Contract thỏa thuận dịch vụ Review the service agreement carefully. terms of service /tɜːrmz ʌv ˈsɜːrvəs/ Legal điều khoản dịch vụ Accept the terms of service to continue. service level /ˈsɜːrvəs ˈlevəl/ Standard mức độ dịch vụ Premium service level includes 24/7 support. maintenance plan /ˈmeɪntənəns plæn/ Support kế hoạch bảo trì Annual maintenance plan recommended. support package /səˈpɔːrt ˈpækɪdʒ/ Service gói hỗ trợ Basic support package included free. response time /rɪˈspɑːns taɪm/ Performance thời gian phản hồi Guaranteed 4-hour response time. uptime guarantee /ˈʌptaɪm ˌɡærənˈtiː/ Reliability đảm bảo thời gian hoạt động 99.9% uptime guarantee for all services. service interruption /ˈsɜːrvəs ˌɪntəˈrʌpʃən/ Issue gián đoạn dịch vụ Notify customers of any service interruption. technical support /ˈteknɪkəl səˈpɔːrt/ Assistance hỗ trợ kỹ thuật Technical support available 24/7. customer care /ˈkʌstəmər ker/ Service chăm sóc khách hàng Contact customer care for assistance.

docs.title: c. Legal & Policy Terms (Thuật ngữ pháp lý và chính sách)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ liability /ˌlaɪəˈbɪləti/ (n) trách nhiệm pháp lý Company liability is limited by agreement. exclusion /ɪkˈskluːʒən/ (n) loại trừ Read all warranty exclusions carefully. limitation /ˌlɪməˈteɪʃən/ (n) hạn chế Time limitations apply to all claims. void /vɔɪd/ (adj/v) vô hiệu Tampering will void the warranty. breach /briːtʃ/ (n/v) vi phạm Contract breach may result in penalties. compliance /kəmˈplaɪəns/ (n) tuân thủ Compliance with terms is mandatory. indemnity /ɪnˈdemnəti/ (n) bồi thường Indemnity clause protects both parties. disclaimer /dɪsˈkleɪmər/ (n) tuyên bố từ chối Legal disclaimer appears at document end. jurisdiction /ˌdʒʊrəsˈdɪkʃən/ (n) thẩm quyền Disputes subject to local jurisdiction. arbitration /ˌɑːrbəˈtreɪʃən/ (n) trọng tài Arbitration required for major disputes.

docs.title: d. Coverage & Protection Details (Chi tiết bảo hiểm và bảo vệ)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ comprehensive coverage /ˌkɑːmprəˈhensɪv ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/ Protection bảo hiểm toàn diện Comprehensive coverage includes all parts. limited warranty /ˈlɪmətəd ˈwɔːrənti/ Restriction bảo hành có hạn Limited warranty covers manufacturing defects only. extended protection /ɪkˈstendəd prəˈtekʃən/ Additional bảo vệ mở rộng Extended protection available for purchase. full replacement /fʊl rɪˈpleɪsmənt/ Benefit thay thế hoàn toàn Full replacement within first 30 days. partial coverage /ˈpɑːrʃəl ˈkʌvərɪdʒ/ Limited bảo hiểm một phần Partial coverage after warranty expires. accidental damage /ˌæksəˈdentəl ˈdæmɪdʒ/ Exclusion hư hại do tai nạn Accidental damage not covered by warranty. normal wear /ˈnɔːrməl wer/ Exclusion hao mòn bình thường Normal wear and tear excluded from coverage. manufacturing defect /ˌmænjəˈfæktʃərɪŋ ˈdiːfekt/ Coverage lỗi sản xuất Manufacturing defects covered for two years. water damage /ˈwɔːtər ˈdæmɪdʒ/ Exclusion hư hại do nước Water damage voids all warranties. unauthorized repair /ʌnˈɔːθəraɪzd rɪˈper/ Violation sửa chữa không được ủy quyền Unauthorized repair voids warranty coverage.

docs.title: e. Service Process & Procedures (Quy trình và thủ tục dịch vụ)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ registration /ˌredʒəˈstreɪʃən/ (n) đăng ký Product registration required for warranty. activation /ˌæktəˈveɪʃən/ (n) kích hoạt Service activation takes 24-48 hours. verification /ˌverəfəˈkeɪʃən/ (n) xác minh Identity verification required for claims. documentation /ˌdɑːkjəmenˈteɪʃən/ (n) tài liệu Provide documentation of purchase date. inspection /ɪnˈspekʃən/ (n) kiểm tra Professional inspection determines coverage. assessment /əˈsesmənt/ (n) đánh giá Damage assessment completed within 5 days. authorization /ˌɔːθərəˈzeɪʃən/ (n) ủy quyền Pre-authorization required for major repairs. approval /əˈpruːvəl/ (n) phê duyệt Claim approval processed in 7-10 days. processing /ˈprɑːsesɪŋ/ (n) xử lý Claims processing may take several weeks. resolution /ˌrezəˈluːʃən/ (n) giải quyết Final resolution depends on inspection results.

docs.title: f. Customer Rights & Responsibilities (Quyền và nghĩa vụ khách hàng)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ consumer rights /kənˈsuːmər raɪts/ Legal quyền người tiêu dùng Know your consumer rights before purchasing. return policy /rɪˈtɜːrn ˈpɑːləsi/ Guidelines chính sách đổi trả Return policy clearly stated on receipt. proper usage /ˈprɑːpər ˈjuːsɪdʒ/ Requirement sử dụng đúng cách Proper usage required to maintain warranty. care instructions /ker ɪnˈstrʌkʃənz/ Guidelines hướng dẫn chăm sóc Follow care instructions to prevent damage. proof of purchase /pruːf ʌv ˈpɜːrtʃəs/ Documentation bằng chứng mua hàng Proof of purchase required for all claims. original packaging /əˈrɪdʒənəl ˈpækɪdʒɪŋ/ Requirement bao bì gốc Keep original packaging for returns. timely notification /ˈtaɪmli ˌnoʊtəfəˈkeɪʃən/ Obligation thông báo kịp thời Timely notification of defects required. reasonable care /ˈriːznəbəl ker/ Standard chăm sóc hợp lý Exercise reasonable care in product use. good faith /ɡʊd feɪθ/ Principle thiện chí All parties must act in good faith. dispute resolution /dɪˈspjuːt ˌrezəˈluːʃən/ Process giải quyết tranh chấp Dispute resolution process outlined in contract.

docs.title: Exercise C: Warranty Claim Analysis
docs.text:
Determine coverage for these warranty scenarios:

📋 WARRANTY CLAIM SCENARIOS

SCENARIO A: "My laptop screen cracked after I dropped it while traveling for work. The laptop is 8 months old and still under the manufacturer's 1-year warranty. Can I get it repaired for free?"

SCENARIO B: "The washing machine's motor stopped working after 18 months of normal use. I have the original receipt and warranty certificate. The warranty states '2-year full coverage on all parts and labor.'"

SCENARIO C: "I installed third-party RAM in my desktop computer to upgrade performance. Now the computer won't start. The computer is 6 months old with a 3-year warranty. Will the manufacturer fix it?"

SCENARIO D: "My smartphone battery drains very quickly after 14 months of use. The phone came with a 2-year limited warranty that covers 'manufacturing defects but excludes normal battery degradation.'"

Analysis Questions: 1. Which scenario would likely be covered under warranty? A) Scenario A (dropped laptop) B) Scenario B (motor failure) C) Scenario C (after upgrade) D) Scenario D (battery drain)

  1. What disqualifies Scenario A from coverage? A) Age of product B) User damage/accident C) Expired warranty D) No receipt provided

  2. Why might Scenario C be denied? A) Product too old B) Unauthorized modifications C) No proof of purchase D) Wrong warranty type

Answer Key: 1-B (normal use, within warranty), 2-B (accidental damage), 3-B (third-party modifications)

docs.title: Understanding Contract Language:
docs.text:
📖 LEGAL INTERPRETATION:

MODAL VERBS IN WARRANTIES:
• "Shall" = mandatory obligation
• "Will" = future certainty/promise
• "May" = permission/possibility
• "Must" = requirement/necessity

CONDITIONAL LANGUAGE:
• "If...then" = cause and effect
• "Unless" = exception condition
• "Provided that" = qualification
• "Subject to" = dependent condition

EXCLUSIONARY LANGUAGE:
• "Except" = exclusion marker
• "But not limited to" = partial list
• "In no event" = absolute exclusion
• "Notwithstanding" = despite other provisions

docs.title: a. Email Components & Structure (Thành phần và cấu trúc email)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ subject line /ˈsʌbdʒekt laɪn/ (n) dòng tiêu đề Write a clear and specific subject line. recipient /rɪˈsɪpiənt/ (n) người nhận Double-check all recipients before sending. sender /ˈsendər/ (n) người gửi The sender's contact information is included. salutation /ˌsæljəˈteɪʃən/ (n) lời chào Use an appropriate salutation for business emails. opening /ˈoʊpənɪŋ/ (n) phần mở đầu Start with a professional opening statement. body /ˈbɑːdi/ (n) nội dung chính Keep the email body concise and focused. closing /ˈkloʊzɪŋ/ (n) phần kết thúc End with an appropriate closing phrase. signature /ˈsɪɡnətʃər/ (n) chữ ký Include your professional signature block. attachment /əˈtætʃmənt/ (n) tệp đính kèm Please find the attachment for your review. carbon copy (CC) /ˈkɑːrbən ˈkɑːpi/ (n) bản sao Add relevant colleagues to CC for visibility. blind carbon copy (BCC) /blaɪnd ˈkɑːrbən ˈkɑːpi/ (n) bản sao ẩn Use BCC to protect recipient privacy. forward /ˈfɔːrwərd/ (v) chuyển tiếp Please forward this email to the team.

docs.title: b. Professional Openings & Closings (Lời mở đầu và kết thúc chuyên nghiệp)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ I hope this email finds you well /aɪ hoʊp ðɪs ˈiːmeɪl faɪndz ju wel/ Opening tôi hy vọng bạn khỏe I hope this email finds you well and in good health. I am writing to inquire /aɪ æm ˈraɪtɪŋ tu ɪnˈkwaɪər/ Purpose tôi viết để hỏi I am writing to inquire about the project status. I would like to follow up /aɪ wʊd laɪk tu ˈfɑːloʊ ʌp/ Purpose tôi muốn theo dõi I would like to follow up on our previous discussion. Please find attached /pliːz faɪnd əˈtætʃt/ Reference xin vui lòng xem đính kèm Please find attached the requested documents. I look forward to /aɪ lʊk ˈfɔːrwərd tu/ Anticipation tôi mong chờ I look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you for your time /θæŋk ju fɔːr jʊr taɪm/ Gratitude cảm ơn thời gian của bạn Thank you for your time and consideration. Best regards /best rɪˈɡɑːrdz/ Closing trân trọng Best regards and have a great day. Kind regards /kaɪnd rɪˈɡɑːrdz/ Closing kính chúc Kind regards from the entire team. Sincerely yours /sɪnˈsɪrli jʊrz/ Formal closing kính thư Sincerely yours in business partnership. Warm regards /wɔːrm rɪˈɡɑːrdz/ Friendly closing chúc ấm áp Warm regards and continued success.

docs.title: c. Business Communication Phrases (Cụm từ giao tiếp kinh doanh)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ as per your request /æz pər jʊr rɪˈkwest/ Reference theo yêu cầu của bạn As per your request, I am sending the report. in reference to /ɪn ˈrefərəns tu/ Context liên quan đến In reference to your email dated March 15th. further to our discussion /ˈfɜːrðər tu aʊr dɪˈskʌʃən/ Follow-up tiếp theo cuộc thảo luận Further to our discussion yesterday morning. I regret to inform you /aɪ rɪˈɡret tu ɪnˈfɔːrm ju/ Bad news tôi tiếc phải thông báo I regret to inform you of the project delay. I am pleased to announce /aɪ æm pliːzd tu əˈnaʊns/ Good news tôi vui mừng thông báo I am pleased to announce our successful quarter. could you please /kʊd ju pliːz/ Polite request bạn có thể vui lòng Could you please send me the updated figures? I would appreciate /aɪ wʊd əˈpriːʃieɪt/ Request tôi sẽ đánh giá cao I would appreciate your prompt response. at your earliest convenience /æt jʊr ˈɜːrliəst kənˈviːniəns/ Timeline khi bạn thuận tiện sớm nhất Please reply at your earliest convenience. due to unforeseen circumstances /duː tu ˌʌnfɔːrˈsiːn ˈsɜːrkəmstænsəz/ Explanation do hoàn cảnh bất khả kháng Due to unforeseen circumstances, we must postpone. please do not hesitate to contact /pliːz duː nɑːt ˈhezəteɪt tu ˈkɑːntækt/ Invitation xin đừng ngần ngại liên hệ Please do not hesitate to contact me for clarification.

docs.title: d. Email Types & Purposes (Loại email và mục đích)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ inquiry /ɪnˈkwaɪəri/ (n) câu hỏi Send an inquiry about product availability. request /rɪˈkwest/ (n/v) yêu cầu Submit a formal request for approval. proposal /prəˈpoʊzəl/ (n) đề xuất The proposal outlines our recommended approach. confirmation /ˌkɑːnfərˈmeɪʃən/ (n) xác nhận Please send confirmation of your attendance. notification /ˌnoʊtəfəˈkeɪʃən/ (n) thông báo Automatic notification will be sent to all users. reminder /rɪˈmaɪndər/ (n) lời nhắc nhở This is a friendly reminder about tomorrow's meeting. apology /əˈpɑːlədʒi/ (n) lời xin lỗi Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience. complaint /kəmˈpleɪnt/ (n) khiếu nại We take every customer complaint seriously. invitation /ˌɪnvəˈteɪʃən/ (n) lời mời Formal invitation to the annual company dinner. announcement /əˈnaʊnsmənt/ (n) thông báo Important announcement regarding policy changes. follow-up /ˈfɑːloʊ ʌp/ (n/v) theo dõi Schedule a follow-up meeting next week. acknowledgment /ækˈnɑːlɪdʒmənt/ (n) xác nhận nhận được Acknowledgment of receipt will be sent automatically.

docs.title: e. Formal Language & Tone (Ngôn ngữ trang trọng và giọng điệu)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ I trust this finds you /aɪ trʌst ðɪs faɪndz ju/ Formal opening tôi tin rằng điều này tìm thấy bạn I trust this finds you in excellent health. I take the liberty of /aɪ teɪk ðə ˈlɪbərti ʌv/ Permission tôi xin phép I take the liberty of writing to you directly. I have the honor to /aɪ hæv ði ˈɑːnər tu/ Very formal tôi có vinh dự I have the honor to represent our organization. may I suggest /meɪ aɪ səˈdʒest/ Polite suggestion tôi có thể đề xuất May I suggest an alternative approach? would it be possible /wʊd ɪt bi ˈpɑːsəbəl/ Polite inquiry liệu có thể không Would it be possible to reschedule the meeting? I should be grateful /aɪ ʃʊd bi ˈɡreɪtfəl/ Formal request tôi sẽ biết ơn I should be grateful for your prompt attention. please accept my apologies /pliːz əkˈsept maɪ əˈpɑːlədʒiz/ Formal apology xin chấp nhận lời xin lỗi Please accept my apologies for any inconvenience. I remain /aɪ rɪˈmeɪn/ Formal closing tôi vẫn I remain at your service for any assistance. respectfully yours /rɪˈspektfəli jʊrz/ Very formal closing kính thư Respectfully yours in professional collaboration. your obedient servant /jʊr əˈbiːdiənt ˈsɜːrvənt/ Extremely formal tôi là người phục vụ của bạn Your obedient servant in business matters.

docs.title: f. Digital Communication Etiquette (Nghi thức giao tiếp kỹ thuật số)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ netiquette /ˈnetɪkət/ (n) phép lịch sự trên mạng Follow proper netiquette in all communications. thread /θred/ (n) chuỗi thảo luận Please keep responses within the same thread. reply all /rɪˈplaɪ ɔːl/ (v) trả lời tất cả Use reply all only when necessary for everyone. auto-reply /ˈɔːtoʊ rɪˈplaɪ/ (n) trả lời tự động Set up auto-reply for vacation periods. out-of-office /aʊt ʌv ˈɔːfəs/ (adj) ngoài văn phòng Activate out-of-office message when traveling. priority /praɪˈɔːrəti/ (n) mức ưu tiên Mark emails as high priority only when urgent. encryption /ɪnˈkrɪpʃən/ (n) mã hóa Use encryption for sensitive information. confidential /ˌkɑːnfəˈdenʃəl/ (adj) bí mật Mark confidential emails appropriately. disclaimer /dɪsˈkleɪmər/ (n) tuyên bố từ chối Legal disclaimer appears in email signature. unsubscribe /ˌʌnsəbˈskraɪb/ (v) hủy đăng ký Provide easy unsubscribe options for newsletters.

docs.title: Standard Business Email Template:
docs.text:
📧 PROFESSIONAL EMAIL STRUCTURE

📋 HEADER SECTION:
To: [recipient@company.com]
CC: [relevant.colleague@company.com]
BCC: [if needed for privacy]
Subject: [Clear, specific, actionable subject line]

👋 SALUTATION:
• Formal: Dear Mr./Ms. [Last Name],
• Semi-formal: Hello [First Name],
• Group: Dear Team/Colleagues,

📝 OPENING PARAGRAPH:
• State purpose clearly
• Reference previous communication if applicable
• Provide context briefly

💼 BODY PARAGRAPHS:
• Main message with supporting details
• Use bullet points for clarity
• One idea per paragraph
• Be concise and specific

🎯 CLOSING PARAGRAPH:
• Summarize action items
• State next steps clearly
• Express appreciation/goodwill

✍️ SIGN-OFF:
• Best regards, / Kind regards,
• [Your Full Name]
• [Your Title]
• [Company Name]
• [Contact Information]

docs.title: Subject Line Best Practices:
docs.text:
✅ EFFECTIVE SUBJECT LINES:

ACTION-ORIENTED:
• "Action Required: Approve Budget by March 15"
• "Please Review: Q2 Marketing Proposal"
• "Urgent: Client Meeting Rescheduled"

DESCRIPTIVE & SPECIFIC:
• "Weekly Team Meeting - March 12, 2 PM"
• "Invoice #12345 - Payment Due April 1"
• "Project Alpha Status Update - Week 3"

QUESTION-BASED:
• "Can we reschedule today's 3 PM meeting?"
• "Are you available for a quick call tomorrow?"
• "What's your preference for the venue?"

❌ AVOID:
• Vague subjects: "Quick question", "FYI", "Hi"
• ALL CAPS: "URGENT!!!", "PLEASE READ NOW!!!"
• Overly long: More than 60 characters
• No subject line at all

docs.title: Tone Levels by Relationship:
docs.text:
🎯 APPROPRIATE TONE MATCHING:

VERY FORMAL (CEO, Legal, External VIPs):
• "I have the honor to inform you..."
• "I should be grateful if you could..."
• "Please accept my sincere apologies..."

BUSINESS FORMAL (Management, Clients):
• "I am writing to inform you..."
• "Would it be possible to..."
• "Thank you for your consideration..."

PROFESSIONAL (Colleagues, Regular Contacts):
• "I wanted to update you on..."
• "Could you please help me with..."
• "Thanks for your quick response..."

FRIENDLY PROFESSIONAL (Close Colleagues):
• "Hope you're doing well..."
• "Just wanted to check in on..."
• "Thanks so much for your help!"

docs.title: 1. Inquiry Email:
docs.text:
Subject: Inquiry About [Specific Product/Service]

Dear [Name],

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to inquire about [specific information needed] for our upcoming [project/purchase/event].

Could you please provide information about:
• [Specific detail 1]
• [Specific detail 2]  
• [Specific detail 3]

I would appreciate receiving this information by [date] if possible, as we need to make our decision by [deadline].

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
[Your name]

docs.title: 2. Request Email:
docs.text:
Subject: Request for [Specific Action/Information]

Dear [Name],

I am writing to request [specific action needed] for [clear reason/context].

Background: [Brief explanation of situation]

Request: [Detailed description of what you need]

Timeline: [When you need this completed]

Please let me know if you need any additional information or if there are any questions about this request.

Thank you for your consideration.

Kind regards,
[Your name]

docs.title: 3. Complaint Email:
docs.text:
Subject: Concern Regarding [Specific Issue]

Dear [Name/Customer Service],

I am writing to bring to your attention an issue I experienced with [product/service] on [date].

Issue Description: [Clear, factual description]

Impact: [How this affected you/your business]

Desired Resolution: [What you would like to happen]

I have attached [relevant documentation] for your reference.

I would appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to a satisfactory resolution.

Sincerely,
[Your name]

docs.title: 4. Apology Email:
docs.text:
Subject: Apology for [Specific Issue]

Dear [Name],

I am writing to apologize for [specific mistake/issue] that occurred [when/where].

I take full responsibility for [what went wrong] and understand how this may have [impact on recipient].

To address this situation, I have [corrective action taken] and will [preventive measures for future].

Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused.

Respectfully,
[Your name]

docs.title: Exercise A: Email Completion (Part 6 Style)
docs.text:
Complete this business email:

Subject: Follow-up on Marketing Campaign Proposal

Dear Ms. Johnson,

Thank you for taking the time to meet with our team yesterday to discuss the upcoming marketing campaign. I __(1)__ this email finds you well and that you had a chance to review our proposal.

__(2)__ our discussion, I wanted to clarify a few points that came up during the meeting:

• Budget allocation will be finalized by March 15th
• Creative concepts will be presented in two phases
• Timeline allows for three rounds of revisions

I would __(3)__ if you could provide your feedback on these points by Friday, March 10th. This will help us move forward with the project timeline as planned.

Please __(4)__ to contact me if you have any questions or need additional information.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Sarah Mitchell
Marketing Director
Creative Solutions Inc.

Question 1: A) hope B) trust C) expect D) assume

Question 2: A) Further to B) According to C) In addition to D) Prior to

Question 3: A) like B) appreciate C) prefer D) suggest

Question 4: A) feel free B) don't hesitate C) be sure D) make sure

Answer Key: 1-A, 2-A, 3-B, 4-B

docs.title: Exercise B: Email Purpose Recognition (Part 7 Style)
docs.text:
Identify the purpose and analyze these email excerpts:

📧 EMAIL EXCERPT A:
"I regret to inform you that we will need to postpone our scheduled meeting on March 15th due to unforeseen circumstances. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and would like to propose rescheduling for March 22nd at the same time. Please let me know if this alternative works for your schedule."

📧 EMAIL EXCERPT B:
"Following up on our conversation yesterday, I wanted to confirm the details we discussed regarding the software implementation project. As agreed, the testing phase will begin April 1st, with full deployment scheduled for April 15th. Please confirm these dates work with your team's availability."

📧 EMAIL EXCERPT C:
"I am writing to express my concern about the delayed delivery of our order #12345, which was scheduled to arrive last Monday. This delay is impacting our production schedule, and we urgently need to know the revised delivery date. Could you please provide an update on the shipment status?"

📧 EMAIL EXCERPT D:
"On behalf of the entire management team, I am pleased to announce that our Q4 sales exceeded targets by 15%. This outstanding achievement reflects the hard work and dedication of every team member. To celebrate this success, we will be hosting a company dinner next Friday at 6 PM."

Analysis Questions:

  1. What is the primary purpose of Email A? A) To confirm a meeting B) To postpone and reschedule C) To cancel permanently D) To change meeting location

  2. Email B is classified as a: A) Request email B) Complaint email C) Confirmation email D) Inquiry email

  3. The tone of Email C is: A) Neutral and informational B) Frustrated but professional C) Angry and demanding D) Apologetic and understanding

  4. Email D serves to: A) Announce results and celebrate B) Invite people to dinner C) Report financial data D) Thank employees for work

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-C, 3-B, 4-A

docs.title: Exercise C: Professional Language Selection
docs.text:
Choose the most appropriate language for each situation:

Scenario 1: Writing to a potential client for the first time A) "Hey there, hope you're doing great!" B) "I trust this email finds you well." C) "Hi! Just wanted to reach out quickly." D) "What's up? Got a minute to chat?"

Scenario 2: Asking your manager for time off A) "I need to take next Friday off." B) "I'm planning to skip work next Friday." C) "I would like to request time off next Friday." D) "Can I not come in next Friday?"

Scenario 3: Following up on an overdue payment A) "Where's our money? You're really late!" B) "I wanted to follow up on invoice #12345." C) "You forgot to pay us again." D) "Pay up or we'll take action!"

Scenario 4: Declining a meeting invitation diplomatically A) "I can't make it. Bad timing." B) "Unfortunately, I have a conflict at that time." C) "Nope, I'm busy that day." D) "I don't want to attend that meeting."

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-C, 3-B, 4-B

docs.title: Cultural Communication Awareness:
docs.text:
🌍 CULTURAL CONSIDERATIONS:

AMERICAN STYLE:
• Direct and to-the-point
• Friendly but professional tone
• Quick decision-making language
• Individual responsibility emphasis

BRITISH STYLE:
• More formal and diplomatic
• Understated expressions
• Polite indirectness
• Traditional courtesy phrases

INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS:
• Extra formal approach
• Clear, simple language
• Avoid idioms and slang
• Respectful of hierarchy

ASIAN BUSINESS CONTEXT:
• High formality level
• Face-saving language
• Group harmony emphasis
• Indirect communication style

docs.title: Difficult Situation Management:
docs.text:
🔥 CHALLENGING EMAIL SCENARIOS:

DELIVERING BAD NEWS:
• Start with context/reason
• State the facts clearly
• Acknowledge impact
• Offer alternatives/solutions
• End with positive forward movement

HANDLING COMPLAINTS:
• Acknowledge the issue quickly
• Take responsibility appropriately  
• Apologize for inconvenience
• Explain resolution steps
• Prevent future occurrences

DECLINING REQUESTS:
• Thank them for thinking of you
• Explain constraints briefly
• Suggest alternatives if possible
• Leave door open for future
• Maintain positive relationship

GIVING CONSTRUCTIVE FEEDBACK:
• Start with positive aspects
• Be specific about issues
• Focus on behavior, not personality
• Provide clear expectations
• End with confidence/support

docs.title: Email Efficiency Strategies:
docs.text:
⚡ PRODUCTIVITY TIPS:

WRITING EFFICIENCY:
• Use templates for common emails
• Create signature blocks
• Set up auto-responses
• Use bullet points for clarity

MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS:
• Implement folder organization
• Use filters and rules
• Set priority flags appropriately
• Schedule send times

RESPONSE PROTOCOLS:
• Reply within 24 hours
• Acknowledge receipt immediately
• Use "reply all" judiciously
• Keep threads organized

TIME MANAGEMENT:
• Batch email processing
• Set specific email check times
• Use subject lines for quick decisions
• Archive or delete regularly

docs.title: Politeness Levels:
docs.text:
📊 POLITENESS SPECTRUM:

LEVEL 5 - EXTREMELY FORMAL:
• "I should be most grateful if you would consider..."
• "I have the honor to request your kind attention..."
• "May I humbly suggest that we might explore..."

LEVEL 4 - VERY FORMAL:
• "I would be grateful if you could..."
• "May I request your assistance with..."
• "I trust you will give this matter your consideration..."

LEVEL 3 - BUSINESS FORMAL:
• "Could you please help me with..."
• "I would appreciate your feedback on..."
• "Would it be possible to schedule..."

LEVEL 2 - PROFESSIONAL:
• "Can you please send me..."
• "I need your input on..."
• "Let's schedule a meeting to..."

LEVEL 1 - CASUAL PROFESSIONAL:
• "Just wanted to check if..."
• "Quick question about..."
• "Thanks for getting back to me..."

docs.title: Power Distance Considerations:
docs.text:
⬆️ WRITING TO SUPERIORS:
• More formal language

➡️ WRITING TO PEERS:

⬇️ WRITING TO SUBORDINATES:

docs.title: a. Meeting Roles & Structure (Vai trò và cấu trúc họp)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ chairperson /ˈtʃerpɜːrsən/ (n) chủ tọa The chairperson will facilitate today's discussion. moderator /ˈmɑːdəreɪtər/ (n) người điều phối Our moderator will keep us on schedule. facilitator /fəˈsɪləteɪtər/ (n) người hỗ trợ The facilitator helped guide our brainstorming session. participant /pɑːrˈtɪsəpənt/ (n) người tham gia All participants should receive the agenda beforehand. attendee /əˌtenˈdiː/ (n) người tham dự Please confirm all attendees for tomorrow's meeting. presenter /prɪˈzentər/ (n) người trình bày The presenter will share quarterly results. secretary /ˈsekrəteri/ (n) thư ký The meeting secretary will take detailed minutes. stakeholder /ˈsteɪkhoʊldər/ (n) bên liên quan Key stakeholders need to approve this decision. agenda /əˈdʒendə/ (n) chương trình nghị sự Let's review today's agenda items carefully. minutes /ˈmɪnəts/ (n) biên bản Meeting minutes will be distributed by Friday.

docs.title: b. Meeting Participation Phrases (Cụm từ tham gia họp)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ I'd like to add /aɪd laɪk tu æd/ Contribution tôi muốn bổ sung I'd like to add another perspective to this discussion. if I may interject /ɪf aɪ meɪ ˌɪntərˈdʒekt/ Interruption nếu tôi có thể xen vào If I may interject, we should consider the budget. building on that point /ˈbɪldɪŋ ɑːn ðæt pɔɪnt/ Agreement xây dựng trên quan điểm đó Building on that point, I think we need more data. may I suggest /meɪ aɪ səˈdʒest/ Suggestion tôi có thể đề xuất May I suggest we table this for next week? from my experience /frʌm maɪ ɪkˈspɪriəns/ Expertise theo kinh nghiệm của tôi From my experience, this approach works well. I'm inclined to think /aɪm ɪnˈklaɪnd tu θɪŋk/ Opinion tôi có khuynh hướng nghĩ I'm inclined to think we need more research first. let me clarify /let mi ˈklærəfaɪ/ Clarification để tôi làm rõ Let me clarify what I meant by that statement. to summarize /tu ˈsʌməraɪz/ Summary để tóm tắt To summarize, we have three main options. going back to /ˈɡoʊɪŋ bæk tu/ Reference quay lại với Going back to John's earlier point about timing. I have a question about /aɪ hæv ə ˈkwestʃən əˌbaʊt/ Inquiry tôi có câu hỏi về I have a question about the implementation timeline.

docs.title: c. Diplomatic Disagreement Language (Ngôn ngữ bất đồng lịch sự)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ I see your point, however /aɪ siː jʊr pɔɪnt haʊˈevər/ Polite disagreement tôi hiểu quan điểm của bạn, tuy nhiên I see your point, however, I have some concerns. I respectfully disagree /aɪ rɪˈspektfəli ˌdɪsəˈɡriː/ Formal disagreement tôi không đồng ý một cách lịch sự I respectfully disagree with that assessment. I'm not entirely convinced /aɪm nɑːt ɪnˈtaɪərli kənˈvɪnst/ Doubt expression tôi không hoàn toàn tin tưởng I'm not entirely convinced that's the best approach. have you considered /hæv ju kənˈsɪdərd/ Alternative suggestion bạn đã xem xét Have you considered the potential risks involved? I wonder if we might /aɪ ˈwʌndər ɪf wi maɪt/ Gentle suggestion tôi tự hỏi liệu chúng ta có thể I wonder if we might explore other options. with all due respect /wɪð ɔːl duː rɪˈspekt/ Respectful preface với tất cả sự tôn trọng With all due respect, I think we're missing something. I understand the logic, but /aɪ ˌʌndərˈstænd ðə ˈlɑːdʒɪk bʌt/ Reasoned disagreement tôi hiểu logic, nhưng I understand the logic, but we need to consider costs. that's an interesting perspective /ðæts æn ˈɪntrəstɪŋ pərˈspektɪv/ Diplomatic acknowledgment đó là một góc nhìn thú vị That's an interesting perspective, though I see it differently. I'd like to propose an alternative /aɪd laɪk tu prəˈpoʊz æn ɔːlˈtɜːrnətɪv/ Counter-proposal tôi muốn đề xuất một lựa chọn khác I'd like to propose an alternative solution. perhaps we could compromise /pərˈhæps wi kʊd ˈkɑːmprəmaɪz/ Negotiation có lẽ chúng ta có thể thỏa hiệp Perhaps we could compromise on the timeline.

docs.title: d. Presentation & Discussion Language (Ngôn ngữ thuyết trình và thảo luận)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ transition /trænˈzɪʃən/ (n/v) chuyển đổi Let me transition to our next topic. elaborate /ɪˈlæbəreɪt/ (v) làm rõ chi tiết Could you elaborate on that proposal? emphasize /ˈemfəsaɪz/ (v) nhấn mạnh I want to emphasize the importance of timing. illustrate /ˈɪləstreɪt/ (v) minh họa This chart illustrates our growth trajectory. demonstrate /ˈdemənstreɪt/ (v) chứng minh These results demonstrate clear improvement. highlight /ˈhaɪlaɪt/ (v) làm nổi bật I'd like to highlight three key achievements. clarification /ˌklærəfəˈkeɪʃən/ (n) sự làm rõ Thank you for that clarification. elaboration /ɪˌlæbəˈreɪʃən/ (n) sự phát triển Your elaboration helps us understand better. consensus /kənˈsensəs/ (n) sự đồng thuận We need to reach consensus on this issue. brainstorm /ˈbreɪnstɔːrm/ (v) động não Let's brainstorm some creative solutions.

docs.title: e. Meeting Flow & Time Management (Luồng họp và quản lý thời gian)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ let's get started /lets ɡet ˈstɑːrtəd/ Opening chúng ta hãy bắt đầu Let's get started with today's first item. moving on to /ˈmuːvɪŋ ɑːn tu/ Transition chuyển sang Moving on to our budget discussion. we're running short on time /wir ˈrʌnɪŋ ʃɔːrt ɑːn taɪm/ Time pressure chúng ta đang thiếu thời gian We're running short on time, so let's focus. let's table this /lets ˈteɪbəl ðɪs/ Postponement chúng ta hãy hoãn lại Let's table this discussion for next week. we need to wrap up /wi niːd tu ræp ʌp/ Conclusion chúng ta cần kết thúc We need to wrap up this meeting soon. before we conclude /bɪˈfɔːr wi kənˈkluːd/ Pre-closing trước khi chúng ta kết thúc Before we conclude, any final questions? action items /ˈækʃən ˈaɪtəmz/ Tasks nhiệm vụ cần làm Let's review our action items from today. next steps /nekst steps/ Planning các bước tiếp theo What are our next steps for this project? follow-up meeting /ˈfɑːloʊ ʌp ˈmiːtɪŋ/ Continuation cuộc họp tiếp theo We'll schedule a follow-up meeting next week. parking lot /ˈpɑːrkɪŋ lɑːt/ Issue storage khu vực để dành Let's put that issue in the parking lot.

docs.title: f. Professional Speaking Techniques (Kỹ thuật nói chuyên nghiệp)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ let me think about that /let mi θɪŋk əˌbaʊt ðæt/ Buying time để tôi suy nghĩ về điều đó Let me think about that for a moment. that's a great question /ðæts ə ɡreɪt ˈkwestʃən/ Acknowledgment đó là một câu hỏi hay That's a great question. Here's my perspective. I need to circle back /aɪ niːd tu ˈsɜːrkəl bæk/ Return to topic tôi cần quay lại I need to circle back to your earlier point. can I piggyback on that /kæn aɪ ˈpɪɡibæk ɑːn ðæt/ Building agreement tôi có thể xây dựng trên đó Can I piggyback on that idea with another thought? I'm glad you brought that up /aɪm ɡlæd ju brɔːt ðæt ʌp/ Appreciation tôi vui vì bạn đưa ra điều đó I'm glad you brought that up for discussion. speaking from experience /ˈspiːkɪŋ frʌm ɪkˈspɪriəns/ Credibility nói từ kinh nghiệm Speaking from experience, this approach works. correct me if I'm wrong /kəˈrekt mi ɪf aɪm rɔːŋ/ Humility sửa tôi nếu tôi sai Correct me if I'm wrong, but isn't the deadline Friday? I want to make sure I understand /aɪ wɑːnt tu meɪk ʃʊr aɪ ˌʌndərˈstænd/ Confirmation tôi muốn đảm bảo tôi hiểu I want to make sure I understand your proposal. devil's advocate /ˈdevəlz ˈædvəkət/ Challenge perspective người đề xuất quan điểm trái chiều Let me play devil's advocate for a moment. food for thought /fuːd fɔːr θɔːt/ Consideration thứ để suy ngẫm Here's some food for thought on this issue.

docs.title: Meeting Participation Strategy:
docs.text:
📋 EFFECTIVE PARTICIPATION MODEL

🎯 PREPARATION PHASE:
• Review agenda thoroughly
• Prepare key points to contribute
• Anticipate questions and objections
• Research background information

💬 ACTIVE PARTICIPATION:
• Listen actively to all speakers
• Take notes for reference
• Ask clarifying questions
• Build on others' ideas constructively

🤝 COLLABORATIVE APPROACH:
• Acknowledge others' contributions
• Find common ground
• Offer solutions, not just problems
• Support team decision-making

📊 VALUE-ADDED CONTRIBUTION:
• Share relevant experience
• Provide data or examples
• Suggest practical solutions
• Help move discussion forward

docs.title: Speaking Confidence Building:
docs.text:
💪 CONFIDENCE TECHNIQUES:

PREPARATION STRATEGIES:
• Practice key phrases beforehand
• Prepare examples and stories
• Anticipate difficult questions
• Plan opening and closing statements

DELIVERY TECHNIQUES:
• Speak slowly and clearly
• Use pauses for emphasis
• Make eye contact appropriately
• Use gestures naturally

RECOVERY METHODS:
• "Let me rephrase that..."
• "What I meant to say was..."
• "To clarify my point..."
• "I'd like to add to that..."

ENGAGEMENT TACTICS:
• Ask questions to involve others
• Reference previous speakers
• Use inclusive language ("we", "us")
• Encourage different perspectives

docs.title: Professional Presence:
docs.text:
🎭 EXECUTIVE PRESENCE ELEMENTS:

VERBAL COMMUNICATION:
• Clear articulation
• Appropriate volume and pace
• Professional vocabulary
• Confident tone

NON-VERBAL SIGNALS:
• Good posture and positioning
• Appropriate facial expressions
• Professional attire
• Active listening body language

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS:
• Respectful interaction style
• Cultural sensitivity
• Emotional intelligence
• Collaborative approach

docs.title: Scenario 1: Project Status Meeting
docs.text:
🎬 ROLE PLAY: Quarterly Review

SITUATION: You're presenting quarterly results to senior management.

KEY PHRASES TO USE:
• "I'm pleased to report that..."
• "Our key achievements this quarter include..."
• "We faced some challenges with..."
• "Looking ahead, our priorities are..."
• "I'd be happy to answer any questions."

PRACTICE ELEMENTS:
• Present data clearly
• Address concerns diplomatically
• Acknowledge team contributions
• Set expectations for next quarter

docs.title: Scenario 2: Disagreeing with a Proposal
docs.text:
🎬 ROLE PLAY: Strategy Discussion

SITUATION: A colleague proposes a strategy you don't support.

DIPLOMATIC LANGUAGE:
• "I appreciate the thought behind this proposal..."
• "While I see the merits, I have some concerns..."
• "Have we considered the potential drawbacks?"
• "I'd like to suggest an alternative approach..."
• "Perhaps we could explore a hybrid solution..."

PRACTICE ELEMENTS:
• Listen fully before responding
• Acknowledge positive aspects first
• Present concerns constructively
• Offer alternative solutions
• Maintain professional relationships

docs.title: Scenario 3: Facilitating Team Discussion
docs.text:
🎬 ROLE PLAY: Brainstorming Session

SITUATION: You're leading a creative problem-solving meeting.

FACILITATION PHRASES:
• "Let's hear from everyone on this..."
• "What other ideas do we have?"
• "How might we build on that suggestion?"
• "Let's explore this further..."
• "I'm hearing several good options..."

PRACTICE ELEMENTS:
• Encourage participation from all
• Manage dominant speakers tactfully
• Keep discussion focused
• Synthesize different viewpoints
• Guide toward consensus

docs.title: Exercise A: Meeting Phrase Completion
docs.text:
Complete these meeting conversation excerpts:

💬 CONVERSATION 1:
A: "I think we should launch the product next month."
B: "I __(1)__ your enthusiasm, but __(2)__ we considered the marketing budget constraints?"
A: "That's a valid point. What do you __(3)__?"
B: "__(4)__ we could compromise by doing a soft launch first."

💬 CONVERSATION 2:
Chair: "Let's __(5)__ to the budget discussion."
Member 1: "__(6)__ I may add something to the previous topic?"
Chair: "Of course, but let's __(7)__ it brief as we're __(8)__ short on time."

💬 CONVERSATION 3:
A: "The timeline seems too aggressive."
B: "I __(9)__ where you're coming from, __(10)__ we need to meet the client deadline."
A: "__(11)__ we could request a one-week extension?"
B: "That's worth exploring. Let me __(12)__ back to you on that."

Word Bank: appreciate, have, suggest, perhaps, moving, if, keep, running, understand, however, maybe, circle

Answer Key: 1-appreciate, 2-have, 3-suggest, 4-perhaps, 5-moving, 6-if, 7-keep, 8-running, 9-understand, 10-however, 11-maybe, 12-circle

docs.title: Exercise B: Diplomatic Language Selection
docs.text:
Choose the most diplomatic way to express disagreement:

Situation 1: Your colleague suggests an unrealistic deadline.

A) "That's impossible! You're being unrealistic." B) "I'm concerned that timeline might be challenging to meet." C) "You clearly don't understand the complexity involved." D) "That won't work because it's too fast."

Situation 2: Someone proposes a solution you tried before that failed.

A) "We already tried that and it didn't work." B) "That's not going to be effective at all." C) "I have some experience with that approach, and we encountered some challenges." D) "You should know that won't succeed."

Situation 3: A team member interrupts you during your presentation.

A) "Please don't interrupt me while I'm speaking." B) "Let me finish my point, then I'd be happy to address questions." C) "You're being rude by cutting me off." D) "Stop talking and let me continue."

Answer Key: 1-B, 2-C, 3-B

docs.title: Exercise C: Meeting Flow Management
docs.text:
Identify the appropriate response for each meeting situation:

Scenario A: The discussion is going off-topic. Response: ____

Scenario B: One person is dominating the conversation. Response: ____

Scenario C: The meeting is running over time. Response: ____

Scenario D: Someone asks a question you can't answer immediately. Response: ____

Sample Answers: A) "Let's get back to the main agenda item..." B) "Let's hear from others on this topic..." C) "We need to wrap up soon, so let's focus on key decisions..." D) "That's a great question. Let me get back to you with the details..."

docs.title: Managing Difficult Personalities:
docs.text:
😤 CHALLENGING PARTICIPANTS:

THE DOMINATOR:
• "Let's hear other perspectives on this..."
• "I'd like to get input from the whole team..."
• "John, hold that thought while we hear from others..."

THE SILENT MEMBER:
• "Sarah, what's your take on this?"
• "I'd love to hear your expertise on this topic..."
• "Any thoughts from our technical team?"

THE NEGATIVIST:
• "I hear your concerns. What would make this work?"
• "What would need to change for you to support this?"
• "Let's focus on solutions we can implement..."

THE TANGENT TAKER:
• "That's interesting. Let's discuss that separately..."
• "Let's stay focused on today's agenda..."
• "I'll put that in our parking lot for later..."

docs.title: Cross-Cultural Meeting Dynamics:
docs.text:
🌍 CULTURAL CONSIDERATIONS:

HIGH-CONTEXT CULTURES (Asian, Middle Eastern):
• Allow longer pauses for reflection
• Read between the lines carefully
• Avoid direct confrontation
• Show respect for hierarchy

LOW-CONTEXT CULTURES (American, German):
• Be direct and explicit
• Focus on facts and data
• Encourage open debate
• Value efficiency and results

NEUTRAL APPROACHES:
• Ask clarifying questions frequently
• Summarize understanding regularly
• Provide multiple ways to contribute
• Respect different communication styles

docs.title: Virtual Meeting Excellence:

ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES:

FACILITATION TECHNIQUES:

• Clear verbal transitions
• Regular check-ins with participants
• Action item documentation

docs.title: Building Rapport and Trust:

ACTIVE LISTENING SIGNALS:

• "That's a valuable perspective..."

EMPATHY EXPRESSIONS:

• "You raise an important concern..."

COLLABORATION LANGUAGE:
• "How can we work together on this?"
• "What would success look like for everyone?"
• "Let's find a win-win solution..."
• "I'm committed to making this work..."

docs.title: Influence and Persuasion:

docs.title: a. Interview Process & Preparation (Quy trình và chuẩn bị phỏng vấn)
docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ recruiter /rɪˈkruːtər/ (n) nhà tuyển dụng The recruiter scheduled three interviews this week. hiring manager /ˈhaɪərɪŋ ˈmænədʒər/ (n) quản lý tuyển dụng I'll be meeting with the hiring manager tomorrow. candidate /ˈkændɪdeɪt/ (n) ứng viên We have five strong candidates for this position. applicant /ˈæplɪkənt/ (n) người nộp đơn Each applicant must submit a portfolio. screening /ˈskriːnɪŋ/ (n) sàng lọc The initial screening will be by phone. assessment /əˈsesmənt/ (n) đánh giá The technical assessment takes two hours. background check /ˈbækɡraʊnd tʃek/ (n) kiểm tra lý lịch All offers are contingent on background checks. reference /ˈrefərəns/ (n) người giới thiệu Please provide three professional references. portfolio /pɔːrtˈfoʊlioʊ/ (n) hồ sơ năng lực Your portfolio should showcase your best work. resume/CV /rɪˈzuːmeɪ/ (n) sơ yếu lý lịch Please email your updated resume by Friday.

docs.title: b. Interview Questions & Answer Strategies (Câu hỏi và chiến lược trả lời)
docs.text: Cụm từ Phiên âm Loại Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ tell me about yourself /tel mi əˌbaʊt jʊrˈself/ Standard opener hãy kể về bạn Tell me about yourself and your career journey. why do you want this job /waɪ du ju wɑːnt ðɪs dʒɑːb/ Motivation question tại sao bạn muốn công việc này Why do you want this job specifically? what are your strengths /wʌt ɑːr jʊr streŋθs/ Strength assessment thế mạnh của bạn là gì What are your greatest strengths? describe a challenge /dɪˈskraɪb ə ˈtʃælɪndʒ/ Behavioral question mô tả một thử thách Describe a challenge you overcame at work. where do you see yourself /wer du ju siː jʊrˈself/ Future planning bạn thấy mình ở đâu Where do you see yourself in five years? why should we hire you /waɪ ʃʊd wi haɪər ju/ Value proposition tại sao chúng tôi nên tuyển bạn Why should we hire you over other candidates? what's your weakness /wʌts jʊr ˈwiːknəs/ Self-awareness điểm yếu của bạn What's your biggest weakness? salary expectations /ˈsæləri ˌekspekˈteɪʃənz/ Compensation mong đợi về lương What are your salary expectations? do you have questions /du ju hæv ˈkwestʃənz/ Engagement check bạn có câu hỏi nào Do you have any questions for us? when can you start /wen kæn ju stɑːrt/ Availability khi nào bạn có thể bắt đầu When can you start if offered the position?

docs.text: Từ vựng Phiên âm Loại từ Nghĩa tiếng Việt Ví dụ accomplishment /əˈkɑːmplɪʃmənt/ (n) thành tựu My greatest accomplishment was leading the merger. achievement /əˈtʃiːvmənt/ (n) thành quả This achievement earned company-wide recognition. milestone /ˈmaɪlstoʊn/ (n) cột mốc Reaching 1M users was a major milestone. breakthrough /ˈbreɪkθruː/ (n) đột phá The breakthrough came after months of research. innovation /ˌɪnəˈveɪʃən/ (n) sự đổi mới My innovation reduced costs by 30%. initiative /ɪˈnɪʃətɪv/ (n) sáng kiến I launched an initiative to improve efficiency. contribution /ˌkɑːntrɪˈbjuːʃən/ (n) đóng góp My contribution helped secure the largest client. impact /ˈɪmpækt/ (n) tác động The program's impact exceeded expectations. leadership /ˈliːdərʃɪp/ (n) khả năng lãnh đạo My leadership style focuses on collaboration. expertise /ˌekspɜːrˈtiːz/ (n) chuyên môn My expertise is in digital transformation.

docs.title: STAR Method for Behavioral Questions:
docs.text:
🌟 STAR TECHNIQUE:

SITUATION: Set the context
• "In my previous role as..."
• "While working on a project to..."
• "During a particularly challenging period..."

TASK: Describe your responsibility
• "I was responsible for..."
• "My role was to..."
• "I needed to ensure that..."

ACTION: Explain what you did
• "I decided to..."
• "My approach was to..."
• "I implemented a strategy to..."

RESULT: Share the outcome
• "As a result, we achieved..."
• "This led to a 25% increase in..."
• "The outcome exceeded expectations..."

docs.title: Scenario 1: Traditional Interview Questions
docs.text:
🎬 ROLE PLAY: Standard Interview

INTERVIEWER QUESTIONS:
1. "Walk me through your resume."
2. "Why are you interested in this position?"
3. "What's your greatest professional achievement?"
4. "How do you handle pressure and deadlines?"
5. "Where do you see yourself in five years?"

CANDIDATE STRATEGIES:
• Use STAR method for behavioral questions
• Connect answers to job requirements
• Show enthusiasm and genuine interest
• Demonstrate cultural fit
• Ask thoughtful follow-up questions

PRACTICE FOCUS:
• Clear, concise communication
• Professional storytelling
• Confidence and authenticity
• Active listening skills

docs.text:

docs.title: Exercise B: Salary Negotiation Practice
docs.text:
Practice these negotiation scenarios:

Scenario 1: The initial offer is below your expectations. Response: "Thank you for the offer. Based on my research and experience level, I was expecting a range of X-Y. Could we discuss the compensation structure?"

Scenario 2: You want to negotiate additional benefits. Response: "I'm excited about the opportunity. While the salary works, I'd value additional professional development budget. Is that possible?"

Scenario 3: You need time to consider the offer. Response: "I appreciate this generous offer. Could I have 24-48 hours to review the details and get back to you?"

docs.title: Exercise C: Question Bank for Interviewers
docs.text:
Prepare thoughtful questions to ask:

About the Role: - What does success look like in the first 90 days? - What are the biggest challenges facing this position? - How does this role contribute to company goals?

About the Team: - How would you describe the team culture? - What collaboration tools does the team use? - How are decisions typically made?

About Growth: - What career development opportunities are available? - How does the company support professional growth? - What does the promotion path look like?

About the Company: - What excites you most about the company's future? - How has the company adapted to recent changes? - What sets this company apart from competitors?

docs.title: Handling Difficult Questions:
docs.text:
🔥 CHALLENGING SITUATIONS:

ILLEGAL/INAPPROPRIATE QUESTIONS:
• "Are you planning to have children?"
Response: "I'm fully committed to this role and meeting all job requirements."

• "What's your age/religion/marital status?"
Response: "I prefer to focus on my qualifications for this position."

STRESS QUESTIONS:
• "Why should we hire you over 200 other candidates?"
Response: Focus on unique value proposition and proven results.

• "What's your biggest weakness?"
Response: Share genuine weakness with improvement plan.

HYPOTHETICAL SCENARIOS:
• "How would you handle a difficult client?"
Response: Use specific methodology and past examples.
